text: My bf and I were looking for a brunch spot we had not already tried. We were seated immediately inside without a wait. There was no salt and pepper on the table, and there was also an old pitcher of creamer on the table from the previous customer.  I ordered the blackened catfish with cheese grits while he ordered the beef hash. The spices on the fish were perfect, however the grits were very bland. His hash was decent and the biscuits were good, but overall the meals were average at best and I do not anticipate going back.
Old school delicious w a southern flavor. It's a big heavy breakfast so be ready. Never much of a line and always consistent

First off, I had no idea Oprah had restaurants. I was visiting Chicago from LA and was taken here by a family member. Secondly, I loved the decor. Makes you feel comfy and like you're in a real Southern restaurant. Service is always a big thing for me, and our server was kind. We went during a slow day, so it slowed her to be attentive but there weren't very many staff there.  There were so many options and everything sounded good. I ended up getting the shrimp and grits which were so so so good. Now, it wasn't made the traditional way. They had a creamed sauce that the shrimps and grits were in, I believe mushroom based. Whatever it was, it was a nice twist. It came with a side so I got greens. My family had the salmon cakes, greens and red beans and rice. I tried hers and it was delicious. The red beans and rice were so good. The best part was that it was affordable. Often soul food restaurants can be so expensive. Definitely a just visit foodie spot.

Had lunch here and sat outside in the spacious patio.  I ate the pulled pork sandwich (sans bread) which came with a small, tasty side of coleslaw that was just creamy enough, and a yummy mashed sweet potato with pecans on top.  Four stars because the service was a little slow because it seemed like there was only one server for the whole outdoor space. I would dine here again and try another item from their interesting and extensive menu.
Great service and good food!! Definitely should be on your list of places to try when you visit the West Loop.

Food was good but the wait time to get our food was too long.  If you're starving, I suggest not going there. 40-minute wait for food.  I got salmon cakes with potatoes and my co-workers got brisket and grilled chicken.  Our server wasn't too attentive, the food runners had taken care of us more. But still tipped 20%.  Just not what I expected, my parents used to come here for their date nights when they first met and loved it, so I gave it a shot and was super excited... but wait time wasn't worth it.
Really enjoyed the Shrimp and grits with a side of cheese eggs and muffin. Had a Bellini to drink.  Enjoyed the meal and the ambiance.

I have been dining at Wishbone for fifteen years and I have never had a bad meal here. The food is always fresh and delicious. My favorite is the cajun shrimp and grits and the blackened catfish with hoppin' jack. The service is good and you couldn't ask for better options when it comes to southern food. A must try if you are visiting the west loop area.

I will say right away their customer service is A+. Everyone including waitresses and Bussers were extremely friendly. Their manager Jeff was very nice as well. This restaurant is very clean and the air condition was on high, which felt amazing on a hot summery day. The only food I tried so far was brisket and I LOVED it! I will be back :-)
I had the brisket plate and it was awesome! Food came out in a very timely manner. And my waitress, Latrice was fabulous. Great service and so sweet!

EXCELLENT EXCELLENT EXCELLENT!!!! Don and Q at the bar are the best bartenders in the West Loop! They took excellent care of us for brunch. We are visiting from Maryland and New York for my friends birthday and we had to stop at Wishbone! The Cajun Shrimp and Grits are the  bomb.com !! I cannot leave out Jeff! Jeff is amazing. We had a rough start with one of the servers and we moved to the bar. Jeff and the bartenders went above and beyond to rectify the situation. Comp drinks, dessert and EXCELLENT customer service. We will be back!!! Thanks again.  To top it off the waitress came and apologized! You don't find establishments like this anymore. Love it! P.S. - Ask for a Moonshine Mary

I was surprised at the blackened Salmon, it ended up being the highlight of the meal. It was perfectly cooked, very flavorful. Everything else was good, but not special. I also had the cornflake French toast, cheese grits, green beans, coleslaw. Service was ok. They brought us the wrong (plain) French toast, even though they double checked our order.

The crunchy French toast and corn cakes are both incredible!!!!! I took a pic but the French toast has a bite out of it.  Couldn't wait, it looked so good.  The service was fantastic, and the patio is huge, clean, and comfy.  We loved Wisbone!
Good breakfast; variety of omlette options and other standard breakfast fare. Outdoor seating available, but a fun main dining room too.

Yesterday my mom and I went here for dinner. We had the fried catfish with sweet potatoes and mac and cheese. The catfish was perfectly cooked and the sauce that is paired with it is delicious. We also ordered the fried green tomatoes my said the were perfect. For dessert we had the chocolate pecan pie. It was very good and fresh as if they just took it out of the oven. The service was great I will definitely return.

Came here for a work brunch and was not disappointed! Portions are huge and the foods tasty, what's not to love? Service & atmosphere: there were quite a few of us and besides some late-coming waters, service was warm and attentive. The space is homey, colorful, and warm.  Food: thanks to my peer pressure, I was able to sample quite a bit of everyone's brunch choices. First off, I had iced coffee which came in a huge mason jar (I couldn't even finish it for fear of getting too wired!). I ordered the crawfish cakes which were full of lots of crawfish meat and combined with eggs, sweet red pepper sauce, and cheesy grits, it was so tasty. I split the biscuits and gravy as well, the biscuit was huge and fluffy with big pieces of sausage in the gravy. I also sampled the chicken andouille hash, shrimp and grits, and Cajun shrimp and grits (yes I'm greedy and yes I took advantage of my coworkers' kindness). Out of those three I'd say the Cajun shrimp and grits was the best, with the sauce being flavorful without heavy and just the right amount of kick to balance the creamy grits.  Great choice for southern comfort food, I'll be back to try the fried chicken!

Everything was Meh. My mac and cheese was cold and congealed, they took a little longer than I would have expected taking into account of how many people were in there. They're service was good, though! Friendly staff!

Came here for Sunday brunch with a small group of people. The service was a bit slow but overall the food was good. We had a few issues with our order but I really enjoyed my French Toast. The others at my table seemed to like their omelettes as well. I think the main issue was that half the group really liked Wishbone while the other half was on the fence.

Wishbone is one of my favorite spots however my recent experience was not so great.  We came on Mother's Day, a party of 12. It took our waitress 20 minutes to acknowledge us after we were seated.  I had to go get menus for us and then again we were left alone.  The food was good as always but the service subpar... no upsale, reading of any specials, suggesting any of the drinks being highlighted that day ... just brush pass and we had to be the ones to wave her down for more drinks, etc.  We watched tables come and go and new patrons being quickly serviced by other servers.  Our bill was $200+.  We still left a 15% although very hesitant to do.  Will be back but pray won't get the same type of service.

I've eaten here 3 times, and have been terribly underwhelmed every time.   Good: We brought 5 kids here ages 1 month to 6 on Saturday. They sat us in the back, dealt with 3 booster seats and like 40 different drink orders over 2 hours like champs.  Nicely done, sorry for the mess. Also good: the moonshine iced tea is not as sweet as it sounded, it's very drinkable and tasty Crunchy French toast - I liked this, one of my dining companions thought it wasn't good - I'd order it again, which, given the fact that it is accommodating for groups and kids, that might happen. 2 eggs over easy - perfectly done and very tasty fresh eggs Not so good: Blood mary's are average Blackened catfish - tastes moldy, seriously.   Yankee scrambled eggs: towards the dry side, average. All the benedicts: extremely dry, thick goopy hollandaise and not enough of it at that Pancakes - just average Grits - too thick Biscuit - good salt and butter level, but heavy, not flaky Sorry guys - I know you're a local favorite, but I'm just not feeling it at all...

Loved it, it was empty because of the rain. But I know this place is always packed. Came in with my friend we enjoyed the Butter Fried Chicken with two sides. We even had margaritas. Everything about this place was beautiful from the hostess to the friendly faces around. I must say I will be back maybe with the family or date night. It was a great experience all around and I was stuffed. Well worth it. Great job!

I've been to Wishbone many times, but this is my first time trying the Mac n' cheese. And can I just say, I don't know whose auntie is in the back making it, but it's heavenly! Like, stop dead in your tracks, let me get a order to go, heavenly! Oh, and Anthony is by far the best server I've experienced here--his suggestions and level of service is platinum

I am really mad at this place! The server kept telling me that breakfast items were not available even though they were listed on the dinner menu. I wanted corn pancakes that come with eggs. I was told that they might not be able to make eggs. Turned out it was a nice new server with no training. It was my little 3 year old Birthday and they did not sing happy birthday to him. They could have bought out a flipping candle! Zero for being kid friendly! What a stinky way to celebrate a birthday! Manager and server could care less. Food is nothing to write home about. Corn muffins are very good. Server on Fat Tuesday was exceptional. A lady with dark curly hair made our Fat Tuesday celebration enjoyable and impressed the birthday boy to want to come back for birthday pancakes. I should have gone to IHOP. Corn pancakes are rather tasteless. The fried eggs were good. I was so disappointed that the misinformation. Provided by the waitress and we could care less attitude by the server and manager.

It hurts my heart to write this. My boys and I have been loyal customers for 20+ years. Never had a bad experience until last night. Their usually ample menu was pared down to a single page. We always come for crawfish cakes. Not last night. Wasn't even on the menu. I asked for a menu and was told that WAS the menu. Now, offerings are cut in half. No more all day breakfast. I asked the waitress if the restaurant had been sold or something. I couldn't understand why so many choices had been eliminated. She explained that the owners son had taken over and wanted to simplify the menu. BAD idea. I wrote a note on my check including my phone number expressing my disappointment in the changes stating I would not be back. No call from them so far. Here's a thought... Don't mess with success.

Love the airy feeling, very clean, you can get a cocktail and great soul food. Yummy blackened catfish and fried too, great collard greens and mac& cheese and we inhaled the corn muffins hot from the oven with real butter. Food is always hot; great service not too fond of cheese grits- but all in all a delicious menu and great prices.

Wow. This place was really good. It's huge, first of all. And on a Sunday when everyone is brunching, there was not too long of a wait a little before noon. We all ordered a whole bunch of dishes, potatoes, benedicts, omelettes, frittatas, pancakes, cheese grits - oh my goodness it was fantastic! I was brunching and gallivanting across Charleston and Nashville, having the best Southern food in my life, and the food here definitely was on par. Love it love it love it.

Delicious southern comfort brunch spot in the West Loop! My husband and I met a friend here for brunch (on her recommendation) and we had a great experience there! Their mission is simple: southern comfort classics. They have everything from Benedicts, scrambles, eggs any style, to sandwiches, burgers, etc. We had to wait until our entire party was there, but it didn't take too long and we were quickly seated thereafter.  Our server was really friendly, so that was nice. I ordered a Bellini drink and it was good! A little heavy on the pulp-y side, but nothing terrible. I liked that it was nice and tart and not overly sweet like some bellini's can be! All of us ordered the black bean cakes, but got different sides. I ordered the black bean cakes with roasted red pepper sauce (I could have swam in that sauce - so good!), cheesy grits and a biscuit. Everything was so good!!  I don't know why there are some mixed reviews of the place. We had a wonderful experience and I know we'll be back!

My husband and I stumbled upon this restaurant one Saturday morning when we were new to the West Loop area, and I could not have been more pleased with our find! We arrived around 9 AM, and we got seated right away. The staff was very friendly, and our food came relatively quickly after ordering. I got the Yankee scrambled eggs, and husband got got the Crunchy French Toast - Both were delicious! I was also pleasantly surprised by the affordable prices on the menu, and the quirky charm of the interior decor. I can't wait to go back when I am in more of a "brunch" mood to try some of their signature Cajun seafood dishes like the Shrimp & Grits. This place will definitely be a weekend staple for us!
Shrimp and grits is a must have here!  Really you can't go wrong with anything here! The biscuits are tasty and I usually take some home for later.

If you're looking for a classic diner with great breakfast and options and reasonable price this is the place, can be hard to get away from the trendy brunches in west loop but this is a great low key diner with delicious, fast, well portioned food.
Loads of options, food came out piping hot (which is tough for breakfast food sometimes), quick service, and a good scene. Can get very crowded so get there before 10am or after 1pm.

Came in hungry & unsure of what I actually wanted to eat. Told my waiter I wanted a hearty breakfast with fish. He immediately recommended the Cajun Shrimp & Grits which sounded great but I had been eyeing the crab cakes so my order became the shrimp & gifts with a side of crab cake. Now I've had shrimp & grits before although they are a good choice they're never anything to jump up & down about; but these shrimp & grits brought a new flare to the game. The creamy sauce was blended with seasonings adding the perfect amount of spice in with the scallops, mushrooms & little bits of sausage. I found that the buttermilk biscuit (which closely resembled my grandmother's recipe) with a bit of honey was the perfect way to round out the taste.  The crab cake that I received was just okay. It wasn't a bad crab cake but the seasoning & flare that was shown in making the shrimp & grits set the bar high for everything else that followed. I also sampled the crawfish cake & again I felt underwhelmed. In my opinion both the crab cake & crawfish caked lacked the seasoning to make the fish pop. The breading seemed to tone down the flavors so much to where it felt like I was more so eating a cake with some crab/ crawfish in it. I hope you understand that  I also have to admit the fact that my waiter said it would be $4.95 for the crab cake & I was actually charged $6.95 for one was a little like "aw man come on". My level of thinking is the whole meal is $11.50 you charged me over half for something like 1/4 of the meal.  But hey I paid , I would recommend going, I will go back,& gosh darn it try the Shrimp & grits!

A great meal with amazing attention to detail-transporting me down south with every bite. The catfish had a fantastic crust but was fresh as could be. The mashed sweet potatoes with pecans and just the right amount of brown sugar could pass for desert. And the bread pudding was perfection. Great service too. Bravo!

I had a great experience eating here today. I went with a friend at about 11:30 and we were seated right away. Service was quick and friendly. I ordered the Eggs Benedict, home fries, and a cappuccino. I loved the onions in the home fries. My friend is a southern bell and gave her stamp of approval to the biscuits and gravy (which does not always happen). The Eggs Benedict were good, but maybe a little too lemony. Overall, I loved this place and will definitely go back.

I stopped by Wishbone on a surprisingly warm Sunday afternoon with my boyfriend and a friend visiting Chicago for the weekend. We have been trying to eat our way through the West Loop since we moved to Chicago last year, and since all 3 of us love Cajun food, this place was a no-brainer. 5 stars for food, 2 stars for service, and 3.5 for seating and ambience, but because food is the only critical factor for me, overall 4 stars! We weren't too hungry because we'd had a very heavy dinner the night before, so we ordered 2 dishes for the 3 of us - the fried catfish with a side of home fries and a biscuit and the cajun shrimp and grits with a corn muffin. I also got the Mississippi Mudd coffee (iced coffee with a "southern" touch) for a much needed dose of caffeine.  The food arrived quickly enough, and the dishes had generous, but manageable portions. I hate it when a restaurant tries to substitute quality with quantity (especially if that quantity happens to be a bland potato dish) but this wasn't the case here! The cajun shrimp and grits had plenty of shrimp and the grits were cooked well and had a semblance of texture (soggy food is second of my list of restaurant peeves). The sauce was flavorful and spicy without burning our tastebuds. The fried catfish was crisp and needed a little bit of seasoning (salt and pepper), but was fresh and one of the best fried fish I've had in Chicago. The home fries were more "house potatoes" than chips, and needed some salt as well. The corn muffin was a winner, but the biscuit was a little too flour-y for my taste. The iced coffee was perfectly sweetened and really refreshing. The service was SLOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOW. I wanted to order my iced coffee as an afterthought, but  our server disappeared after our food order and didn't come anywhere near for a really long time, so I had to approach another server (who was really nice about it!). The place wasn't too busy so I can't rationalize the delay. Similarly, we were waiting for a good 15 minutes to pay the cheque, and finally, we just went in and paid it at the front desk, at which point our server magically appeared out of nowhere to ring us out. The interior was lively and had a really cozy feel. I'm definitely coming back!
One of the best southern food brunches in Chicago!  Always returning for more!  Staff is great and so is atmosphere.  Definitely come with an appetite.

My family and I have been coming to Sunday brunch at wishbone forever and it's never a let down. My go-to's are blueberry pancakes, home fries and a side a bacon. But you really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Also great, quick service, and welcoming atmosphere.
Quick Breakfast at Wishbone, eggs, sausage and cheese grits - Perfect!!! And the service is always on point.

My boyfriend and I stopped in for lunch today.  We waited until AFTER the lunch rush--about 1:30pm on a Wednesday.  We were able to sit down right away and had a very nice server. No pulled pork today.  They either ran out by 1:30pm or it just was not available at all today.  I wish our server had told us that before we had made our minds to eat THAT for lunch.  Oh well.  We ordered the blackened chicken and the brisket plates.  I got a side of collard greens and the Kale Salad and his sides were the mac and cheese and Hoppin' Jack (rice and black beans). It took a LONG time to get our food.  Not sure why since the restaurant was not busy.  The food arrived hot, which was a bonus.  The portion size on the chicken was pretty small but it tasted good and was very juice.  The brisket was just okay.  I don't think I would order it again.  Maybe it was the way it was sliced, but it really reminded me of gyro meat. The sides.  The cornbread muffin was good.  The collard greens were bland and missing seasoning.  The kale salad was the BEST though.  I am going to have to try to recreate that at home.  The mac and cheese was rather bland as well and we had to doctor it up with some hot sauce.  The hoppin' jack was good--smothered in cheese and scallions.   Like I said before, our server was very nice.  Not the most attentive of servers, but she made up for that in her "perkiness" when she was by our table. I had not been to Wishbone in YEARS and am happy we stopped for a nice change of pace at lunch.

Dined with friends at Wishbone. Excellent food, service, drinks & atmosphere.  The fried catfish, greens & sweet potatoes were delicious!  Wishbone never disappoints, always offers a wonderful dining experience.

We should have followed our instincts and turned around when we walked in at 7:30 on a Friday night and the place was empty.   1 waitress counting her tips and sorting her receipts  at the dining counter.  Server recommended the brisket only to come back 5 minutes later to tell us sorry out of the brisket.  Ordered the pulled pork which was served lukewarm.   Blackened chicken breast was excellent.  Crab cakes mediocre.   After looking back at all the reviews maybe this is a breakfast/brunch place only.   To many stellar places within a few blocks to ever consider going back.
Everything here SO good, most of us had southern food and really enjoyed it!  Dessert was almost better than the food, I highly recommend Wishbone!!
Good place for all meals. Good place for breakfast all day. Love the cajun twist on most dishes.   Good flavor on every meal I've had.

Customer service is always on point. I had the pleasure of ordering the Jambalaya Omelette which has Cajun stew with smoked chicken, chicken andouille sausage, peppers, onion & tomato. Get the homemade biscuit and cheese grits and you will not be disppointed.
The blackened catfish is EVERYTHING!! Shrimp and grits, corn muffins and biscuits we also really good.

Located in a cute neighborhood in Chicago, I really enjoyed the southern cuisine of Wishbone. This was the family's first time to Chicago and I enjoyed coming outside of the downtown area. Wishbone boasts on its southern menu and I see why they've been named a favorite in Chicago. The service wasn't great; which explains the 4-star, not a 5-star rating; but I'm only referring to our waiter. He seemed a bit distracted and not very attentive. It was a mini reunion at the table and maybe he thought we just wanted our time to catch up, but I just feel like you can still be attentive when people are in conversation...buuut anyhoo. The food came out fast and it was delicious!!!! My entree: crawfish cakes with eggs and grits. It was different and pleasantly delicious! I wish there was more on my plate, because those two cakes disappeared rather quickly  Hubby's entree: blackened chicken. He said he wasn't excited about it. He mentioned it wasn't terrible but the chicken was dry. Children were satisfied for the most part. My son enjoyed his buckwheat pancakes and it filled him up. Daughter had the strawberry pancakes. They cooked the strawberries in the pancakes, which she didn't like (texture) but enjoyed the pancakes. Another daughter had the children's breakfast burrito. It was very bland. It was cheese and eggs...not very appetizing. We sent it back and she got pancakes. So there you go.  The atmosphere is very cozy and inviting. I wish my server was a bit more attentive but we'll be back

Great spot for brunch. The portions are fairly large for the price! I had the biscuits and gravy and they were absolutely delicious. The food came out fairly quickly after we ordered and my waiter was always there to top off our coffee. The wait can sometimes be pretty lengthy especially for weekend brunch so keep this in mind when planning!

I was noy happy with my order. The pancakes and grits had a chalky after taste, the eggs were runny, and bacon was over cooked. The manager came and took everything off except the drinks...wow...now we have to find another place to eat and buy new drinks. A waste of gas and $6 on drinks.

I ordered from Wishbone for delivery yesterday, and the meal came timely. However, being a true southerner, I was disappointed in a lot of what I ordered. I did like the cornbread muffins (they are sweet like most in the south make). Didn't like their tangy spicy BBQ sauce, their crawfish and salmon cakes aren't nearly as good as I've had at home, and they put sugar in their collard greens. I won't criticise the collard greens too harshly because the sweetness wasn't too much and otherwise great.... some people in the south do put sugar in them, not all, and I just personally don't like collard greens sweet... AND..... DO NOT ORDER THE RED BEANS AND RICE!!!! I was horrified to find the restaurant smothers melted cheddar cheese and salsa on top of their red beans and rice!! As a Mississippi/Louisiana native, I know that NO one in the south would ever ruin our coveted red beans and rice with such toppings! I was hoping for the taste of New Orleans, and instead received the taste of Mexico!! PLEASE STOP putting cheese and salsa on red beans and rice PLEASE! Then I might actually eat at wishbone again! Until then... i can't imagine any true southerner wanting to be a repeat customer from what I ordered. Overall, a BIG let down for my craving of southern comfort food.

SUCH yummy food. I walked in and immediately smelled that southern barbecue smell that I love. I ordered an entree that was around $13 and got so much food.  I ate with 10 other people who loved the fried okra, mac & cheese, chicken, etc. FYI - their monkey fruit is just a small bowl of fruit. I will likely be back for more mac & cheese. They also have moonshine stocked at the bar. Had I not been on a work lunch, I would've looked into some cocktails!

The service and ambiance are great! Definitely a good spot to dine, chat and chill. They have a full bar, and I could see this being a great spot for after work drinks and apps or brunch and Bloody Mary's. I can't say the food was the best I've had, but about average. I will come back!

Great place for southern soul cooking. Everything we had was excellent! Shrimp and grits are amazing. The crab cakes are as good as any I've had on the eastern seaboard. They were served with homemade Mac 'n cheese and collard greens cooked with turkey. Finished it all off with sinful peach cobbler and the best coffee (French press) I've had in years. Service was exceptional too! Can't wait to go back for breakfast!!

Your local, neighborhood Southern joint is right here at your fingertips at Wishbone! I had the pleasure of dining with my friend and his Mama while she was in town at what I'd consider to be some great Southern comfort food, depending on what you get! We sat inside on a not-so-crowded Tuesday evening, and our waiter Eli was fantastic in making sure we were kept hydrated and fed. Out first came our corn bread which was pretty good! Be sure to get more during your meal if you have a hankering for it. Next came the Crawfish CakeS... the name is misleading because you only really got a small piece for $6. It had some good flavor to it, but just wished it was hotter and bigger considering how hungry we were. Our food came shortly after and we were greeted with a massive piece of fried catfish. The fish was very good and the batter was crunchy! The size made up for the appetizer, but I wish the batter was more infused with the fish itself. It felt very separate from the catfish, but who am I to complain? It was still good. My sides were the cheese grits and mashed sweet potatoes, both of which were good in itself. For dessert, we ordered the peach cobbler (bomb!) and the Strawberry key lime pie, which was literally a shaved strawberry on top of a slice of pie. While not the most original, it was still good and filling. Wishbone has got its formula down, no complaints there. If you are looking for good (albeit pricey) Southern food in the West Loop, this is a solid option.

Every time I come here I leave very pleased. The food is good and consistent. You can choose between american classics, cajun/creole classics, or southern classics. I have tried their southern catfish, yankee scramble, red eggs, hash, and pancakes. All were great. Even their in house bloody mary is good. Service has always been good, even when they are very busy. I have never had to wait long for an order to be taken or to get the check. The artwork on the walls is a little weird but fitting. It's like Dali or some other surrealist painted breakfast art.

Just okay for me; nothing special.  Or maybe I ordered the wrong thing.  I got the Chicken Andouille sausage hash which came with scrambled eggs and a biscuit.   The sausage in the hash was either overcooked, or it had been sitting for awhile.  Either way it wasn't fresh or really appealing to me.  The eggs were too soft.  I exchanged for beef brisket which was a bit of an improvement.  But the eggs were exchanged for what looked like the yellow liquid ones you buy in the grocer. Well, the server was attentive and helpful.  It wasn't his fault.  From now on I think I'll have breakfast at places that are renowned for quality breakfasts.

I was by myself and had their brunch menu at the bar on Sunday. No wait. A trainee was tending bar but was very capable and nice. I ordered red beans and rice, fried eggs, a biscuit, and french toast. All came quickly and were fresh. Very delicious and enjoyable experience.

I  ordered brown rice and food came with white rice. Jambalaya is a bit spicy !! Please listen to your customers. The menu is interesting. Please work on the older waitress with short hair. We had food and no utensils. My hubby ordered a soda and it never arrived !
One of my fave Chi-town joints! Delicious food, cool atmosphere and good service. Best shrimp & grits. Salmon cakes a light and not breaded.

I think breakfast might be Wishbone's specialty.  Dinner is not-so-good.  Have had delivery a few times, and dined-in as well.  The only item I liked were the cheese grits.  They were fantastic.  Pulled pork, dry and lousy.  The mini corn muffins while moist, have some odd taste to them.  Couldn't eat them.  (I don't remember this in the past, so they're either inconsistent, or have changed them.)  Mashed sweet potato side was good, but portion tiny for $4.  Iceberg salad was TERRIBLE.  A wedge that seemed to be washed, but not drained whatsoever, sitting in watery, miserable dressing, with a few crumbles of bacon, a few crumbles of blue cheese, and 1 grape tomato sliced in half.  Most of it went directly in the garbage.  I would like to try them for breakfast, but no more dinners.

Went for brunch on a Sunday. The wait was really quick-got our table in less than the 15 min they told us. I had the Shrimp and Grits with Bacon. Good but pretty rich, it's creamier and not tomato based. They don't skimp on the shrimp however so that's good. Also came with a biscuit on the side which was light and fluffy and melt in your mouth delicious. The service was meh...not great but certainly not terrible. Had to ask for water and coffee refills but she was pleasant. Would definitely go back; there were a number of other things I'd like to try.

First, let me say that though I love the food, this is specifically about the catering aspect of Wishbone. Wishbone is catering my upcoming wedding at Promontory Point. From the start, Viri was helpful, professional, and attentive. She did so much more than I expected from a typical caterer: floor plans and equipment set up, assisting with wedding related questions, offering helpful feedback, and stepping in when a production company failed to do their job. Above and beyond, and the wedding hasn't even happened yet.  If you want an extremely reasonably and fair priced caterer whom will personally ensure that your wedding day is a success, go with Wishbone. I am telling all my engaged friends. I couldn't be happier with my choice. They are simply the best! I'll add even more after the ceremony. Thank you, Wishbone.

Wishbone is the perfect place to go for lunch on a Sunday afternoon in the city. Some of my favorite dishes are the crab cakes, the salmon cakes and the red beans and rice. The wait is never too long and you have the option to eat outside or indoors. I have never really had a problem with the service and the food usually comes out fast (and hot!)  If you are looking for a nice place for brunch with a New Orleans kick to it, this is the place to go!

One of my favorite spots. I was originally introduced to Wishbone by my grandmother after she read a review in the newspaper. That was twelve years ago. I've been enjoying their southern cuisine, ever since.  Wishbone's Cajun Shrimp and Grits, Blackened Catfish, jambalaya, and Etouffee are better than any I tasted on my recent trip to NOLA.  I recommend this place to all of my out-of-town friends and anyone in the mood for some flavorful southern food.

4 Words: "Cajun Shrimp and Grits".  Some of the best I've ever had, andi just came from New Orleans.  So well seasoned, grits were cooked just right, and the andouille sausage has just the right amount of spice to bring it all together.  Add the the delicious sweet and potatos with almonds on the side, and you get... five stars. You get a five star yelp review.

That was a nice meal! Lots of choices and plenty of specials makes it a great choice for someone who isn't quite sure they know what to eat. The southern twist makes it more fun too. Add the wacky artwork and the occasional celebrity visit (I saw Rahm once, not sure I'd call him a celebrity, maybe a villain? )

Just finished a late brunch with my girlfriend Laura at Wishbone. We had a great experience. We got a table outside pretty quickly (less than 5 minute wait). Laura had a mimosa and I had a Bloody Mary. Both were great. Food wise, I didn't know what to expect from a Cajun style brunch, but it didn't disappoint. I had a jambalaya omelette that was large and really good. Laura had an omelette as well. I forgot the name of it, but it was damn good too (I snuck a bite). Our waitress was attentive and very helpful. We will definitely be back.

Wishbone was my wedding caterer. I love their food and the service was superb. They were attentive and even saved food for me and the groom to enjoy after our busy evening. The catering captain was a true sweetheart too!

Called in and asked if I could make a reservation and they said that normally they don't, but that they would accommodate for our party of 14. We come in and they had set up two separate tables for us. After asking if they could switch us to one long table, we waited maybe 15 minutes and they changed us to one long table. The food didn't take too long for such a large party and came out all at the same time. However, it felt like they didn't have a big enough kitchen back there to cook everything because I could tell some of the food was cold and had been waiting for the rest of the food to be ready. My sister ordered Eggs Benedict. One of her eggs came out with a hard center, but being who she is she did not complain. The whole point to me of Eggs Benedict is the poached eggs, but that's okay. I ordered a burger without tomatoes. It came out without tomato, onion, lettuce, or pickles. When I asked if I could have onion, lettuce, and pickles, the waitress brought out lettuce and tomato. When I asked again if I could have onions and pickles, she said she thought I had said I didn't want onions and that they don't have pickles...Kind of strange to me because I read another review that talked about having pickles on her sandwich, but overall my food was fine. I ordered the house fries as my side. They are actually potato wedges, not fries. Disappointed but the potatoes were good because they have added sautéed onions with them so I didn't complain. However, they do not put that on the menu so if you have an onion allergy be careful. The mimosas we ordered were excellent and I have to say for being a large party our server was very attentive and always there if we needed her. The place was pretty okay, not bad, just nothing to really rave about.

I've been a fan of wishbone for years. I mean like a 15 year fan. When I have a craving for crab cakes or my all time favorite dish blackened catfish I drop in and they never let me down. Today was no different. Upon arriving I was seated immediately as you usually are because they have plenty of seating indoors and outdoors. My waiter was on it and brought over waters and fresh muffins. These muffins with butter are delicious and a great way to start a meal. Ordered the blackened catfish with black eyed peas with rice and collard greens with turkey as my sides. OMG! Talk about a plate of deliciousness!! They flavor the blackened catfish to perfection. The fish is fresh and not dry at all. The sides are authentic and made to order. No instant boxed stuff here. New Orleans Southern comfort food to the tee. Price point is nice and affordable with nice size proportions. ($13 for my blackened catfish meal with two sides) The only drawback to eating here is as soon as you finish you want to take a nap so if you need to get back to business, I suggest keeping it light. You have been warned.

Place is great! Came here for brunch.  I had  one amazing spinach omelette! Had cream cheese filling inside, diced tomatoes, portabella mushrooms and fresh spinach. It came with cheddar cheese grits and a corn muffin. Loved the food. Service was ok, I wish our waiter was a bit more friendly. Actually I don't even know if we had a waiter, 3 different people stopped by our table lol they have a great outdoor patio by the way  but it was way too hot to be out.  I'd definitely come back to this place! I wanna try their green smoothie!
Good atmosphere and service, the food was good but not the best Southern Food that I've had. The prices were good. I probably won't be going back as the food didn't make a lasting impression.
Saturday brunch with friend... Inside because of the heat. Discovered a Bill Daley! YUM!  Blackened chicken salad very good. Luv this place.

What a great spot. Came here for lunch on a beautiful Friday and sat outside on the patio.  The patio was really nice, very big (street level) and completely covered. Ordered the Shrimp & Grits, which many other yelp reviewers had recommended and that was really good. It came with cornbread and a side (I chose sauteed spinach) and those were also both really good!  We topped the lunch off with dessert which included a nice bread pudding (dense and caramel-y). Would recommend! Would come back. :)

One of the great go-to brunch restaurants in Chicago.  Fantastic NOLA style food.  My wife and daughter shared the craw fish cakes and black bean cakes - they loved them both but craw fish slightly preferred.  I had a jambalaya omelette that was very good, with a side of brisket hash that was outstanding.  Big outdoor covered seating was awesome on a sunny day.  The ice tea and Bloody Mary were also both delicious!   The best thing, frankly, is the friendly, diverse atmosphere.  In a big city with tons of diversity but separate neighborhoods, I don't always seem to dine in a diverse setting. Wishbone consistently stands apart on that front and it is such a welcome change.  It makes you love Chicago!!
Good food. Shrimp and grits were amazing, didnt care for the jambalaya omelette but cheese grits were the best. Also get the biscuits prices werent bad at all

This place has amazing watermelon lemonade. The flavor was amazing. Strawberry and banana pancakes were so good. My only complaint was the bacon . The first time I received the bacon it had a hair on it so I politely sent it back to the kitchen . The second time it had a small piece of white paper on it . So I just cancelled out the bacon . Other than that I had a good experience here .
Decent food. Got the job done. Nothing to complain about but nothing spectacular either. Good service
Love this place have been eating breakfast here for two years almost once a week.  Great food and great service. If you like southern style food this is the spot in the west loop!!

Went for Sunday brunch. Wait time was around 20 mins around noon which is not too bad I guess. The food was okay but I didn't find anything to rant and rave about. I had the crawfish cakes with scrambled eggs and corn muffin. Those were the sorriest looking and the worst scrambled eggs I've ever had. Corn muffin was okay. Crawfish cakes had flavor and they were actually ok. Our water glasses were not refilled. They basically left us alone and didn't check on us once the food was delivered. But then again we were not rushed to get out after our meal. Overall okay experience I'm not in a rush to get back though.
1st time at the spot good atmosphere. I had the jambalaya omelet not impressed. But my wife and kid loves there food.

No wait for a table of 4 on Mother's Day around noon. The space is pretty big and feels semi-open considering the number of people bustling around. There are a few outdoor tables but I'd love to see even more. I'd describe the decor as "farm on acid trip" which I mean as a compliment. Service was prompt and friendly - mysterious menu items like "Hoppin' John" explained, water refilled, good check-ins.  So many things on the menu looked delicious! I got the eggs florentine, which actually had a bit too much cooked spinach on it for me; I would have preferred about half the quantity in fresh uncooked spinach for a little crunch, but it was still tasty. My fiance got smoked beef brisket hash and cleared his plate. We also shared some Hoppin John and some cheese grits, which were actually the best I've had in a while and reminded me of my uncle from Atlanta who used to make them just like that. Quick and affordable for the West Loop, we'd definitely brunch here again!

Sunday 11am, crowded but we were seated immediately and the food all came out in ~13 minutes.  Crab Cakes Benedict with cheese grits and a side of crunchy French toast ($16.75) - SOO GOOD especially the fluffy French toast.    Beef Brisket Hash with corn muffin ($12.95) - the corn muffin was dry and the hash needed a bit more flavor but it tasted better after a drizzle of salt and ketchup.  The perfect place to take your family or friends for breakfast/brunch in West Loop.

Food is bland; waitress seemed disinterested. Ordered shrimp and grits but there wasn't much flavor to the dish even though they added bacon to it. Biscuit seemed bland. Scrambled eggs had a plastic aftertaste. The cheese grits on the side were the best part of the meal (thigh, cheesy, flavorful). Ordered white toast but they brought out whole wheat. Iced coffee was surprisingly delicious! Have eaten here years ago and didn't remember the experience. Left the restaurant after this second time with again, an unremarkable experience. Probably will not return.

What happened here??? I've eaten here several times over a year ago amd decided to come back here for dinner. This is the first time that I've been disappointed with Wishbone. I had their blackened tilapia sandwich, and it was dry and boring. Their house fries, cornbread, and coleslaw are still on point though. The meat was also a little dry. I know they can do better than this, so I'll probably come back to try something else.
I like the food at Wishbone. It's pretty good.

Wishbone is not too far from my neighborhood in the west loop.  I came in for some lunch.  I was seated pretty quickly, and water was served.  It was a few more minutes than I would have liked to be waiting for my actual server.  He was running around in circles throughout my meal but not looking like he was accomplishing much.  Scattered.  I ordered the chargrilled turkey burger sans bun.  All the fixins' on the side (crunchy sweet pickles, overripe mushy tomatoes, yuk, and iceberg lettuce - HATE with a passion).  The burger came (oddly it was shaped a bit like a heart), I love when my burger loves me.  Oh the feels!  Cooked perfect and not dry at all!  Roughly chopped slaw to accompany, fresh and crunchy, with the right touch of vinegar.  Cheesey grits on the side.  Best part of the meal.  A good soup cup portion.  Creamy, good flavor, I heart cheese.   I was finished eating and waiting (humming the jeopardy song, four times I counted) before he came over sweaty from running a marathon with his pinball like actions across the restaurant, didn't even offer me dessert, which I would have ordered (the guy sitting across from me was eating something that looked heavenly), but he just dropped the check.  Well, okay then, no dessert for me.  Hmm

My fiancée and I thought to try Wishbone since they have a dog friendly patio. We were sat and as our server introduced herself she let out a huge burp - it was foul. She apologized but it grossed us out.  I have no comment on the food - the burp coupled with the an unclean restaurant prompted us to leave.

First time trying southern food and was not disappointed. I'm a Mac and cheese fanatic and their Mac n cheese was good. Generous sized portions for reasonable prices. Nice atmosphere. Good service as well. Would go back again.

I  haven't been here in years! It was definitely a treat to come back. The atmosphere is the same which is always good and helps while eating your meal. I  can't remember what the food tasted like before, but I  do remember coming here very often. I had the Crab Cake Benedict which came with the home fries. Normally for breakfast i wouldn't finish my meal. Well, today was a different story. It was very delish. I would definitely come back.

Was here for a recent Saturday breakfast.  With the wife and 4 kids(1 in a high chair) in tow, service was great.  Alway a very kid friendly atmosphere for us. Our kids enjoyed their pancakes, mac & cheese, and coloring place mats. Thank you!

My first visit was yesterday.  The staff was friendly and very attentive.  I order the jambalaya omelet, home fires and whole wheat toast. It was AMAZING! I've never had jambalaya but a spicy chicken stew stuffed in an omelet can't go wrong and it didn't! I also had the peach cobbler for dessert and it was delicious. Pair it with a cup of hot coffee and it's a perfect match

I love this place. I had crab cakes, beans n rice cole slaw. Super delicious! I ordered a side of green beans and carrots and they gave me the skinniest, skimpiest portion ever. My friend ordered pork chops and they were great. Fell off the bone! So delicious.

Just went here for the first time last week and was very happy! We were seated very quickly even though we were a little late for our reservation during the lunch hour. The waitress was very nice and helpful when it came to picking menu items. Everyone in our group loved their food! It was very reasonably priced! I was also very surprised at how minimal of a wait time their was for our good. I will definitely be back!
One of the best for brunch places in the west loop if you are looking for cheap, good quality food. The wait is not too long either. Try the Arnold Palmer. No complaints.

Friends and I were in from out of town and looking for a place to eat Friday night - we stumbled upon this gem after wandering into a few too many places nearby that had 90 minute waits. When we arrived, we got sat immediately, and soon after the waiter was bringing out plates of these complimentary mini corn muffins. Let's just say, if there are carbs in heaven, these things would be front and center - it was like having corn cake cupcakes. For my entree, I got the pulled pork plate, which came with sides of my choice (mac 'n cheese, cole slaw, potatoes). All delicious, and it was around $10 or $12 - unreal considering where we were! Having seen the menu of a BBQ place earlier in the night where the meats didn't come with sides, and sides were $5 each, it was a welcome relief to get such great value. Overall, our service was excellent, and our waiter seemed to go out of his way to accommodate us. If you're looking for a no-frills, diner type of place with a variety of comfort style food, I can't recommend Wishbone enough. It may not have trendy mood lighting or snazzy plate presentations, but if there's one thing millennials like myself enjoy, it's nostalgia, and when you happen to share the same name with a 90's PBS  educational show about a talking Jack Russell Terrier, you've piqued my interest.

MMMM picked this up for a work lunch to go.  I had the black bean cakes (healthy yet not boring!) that came with (very yummy) eggs and wedge potatoes with grilled onions (delish!)  The buttermilk biscuit it came with was SIMPLY BEAUTIFUL.  HEAVEN.  Thanks Wishbone, you made my time at work so much better and happier!  I enjoyed the HELL out of my meal.

Omar A is friendly and efficient. Warm cornbread muffins are addictive. crawfish cakes were tender. I liked the gumbo better than jambalaya. What really put a smile on my face was a peach cobbler with ice cream.

I visited on Feb 27th for brunch. I ordered the eggs Benedict and a glass of orange juice. I was disappointed at the lack of flavor and freshness the dish portrayed. The ham was over done and very tough. The eggs were nicely pouched but the hollandaise sauce was more tart than flavorful. The glass of orange juice was delish! Just slightly expensive for the quantity. The place is good for families . Ppl had strollers and it was very spacious.I was extremely dissatisfied with the lack of customers service. I was seated with ring side view of the front desk. It was impossible to get the attention of our waitress because she was too busy distracting the other waitresses and clean up crew. She was joking and not tending to her tables. One man waited so long to get his check picked up that he got up and handed it in himslef. We also waited longer than needed(mind you she had ignored us the whole meal. She only came to the table once after we got our food) She was extremely distracted and very messy looking. She was the only one wearing a white shirt . This makes ne think she might be a supervisor or manager(I hope not!) I will have to revisit for dinner so I can re review.

Finally went to eat here after wanting to for a long time. The service was great and I had no issues with it at all. I had the Jambalaya omelette with a biscuit and grits. The biscuit and grits were so tasty. However the omelette was average. I would go back to this place to try something different in hopes that it taste better than the omelette. The parking is pay parking on the street and should be easy to find depending on the time of day. I noticed they do have a bar inside of the restaurant which is nice. The place is big so there is plenty of room. The setup of the restaurant is nice & seems very clean.

I adore Wishbone and this has always been my favorite location. Wishbone on Washington is pretty much the only restaurant I can take ANYONE to. Staff is always laid back and friendly; Great food with lots of vegetarian options and good price point; LOVE the Desserts/Arnold Palmers/Mac&Cheese/Blackened Catfish/Sweet Potatoes/Brussels Sprouts...I could go on... Wishbone on Washington is a Chicago Institution at this point. It's one of the only places in the city of Chicago where ALL types of folks come together. Love 'em.

Visited this place on a Friday night, not busy at all. Our server, Ricky was great and our food was great. We did however, wait until after our meal had arrive to get our drinks, which we ordered at the beginning. The only confusion that I had was there were only five other tables that were sat, so I didn't understand why the drinks took so long. Other than that, you can tell the staff works very hard. The food was all very good. We loved the cornbread that came in the beginning!
Where else can you go in the city and get blacken catfish & eggs. Very consistent. Huge fan!
Shrimp Grits were AmazeBalls! ENOUGH SAID. The Catfish was fishy but good. Definitely  will go again to try the Salmon& Crawfish Croquet

I've been to Wishbone a few times over the years. I haven't been especially impressed with the food that I recall so I haven't been a frequent visitor. In the past I've eaten the fish and their sandwiches. i recall being underwhelmed by the dining experience and I'd express similar sentiments after last night's visit. I was in the area with a friend and we decided to check it out. We both hadn't been to Wishbone in years. We parked easily right outside the restaurant and were seated immediately upon entry.  Our waiter was prompt and efficient but wasn't exactly warm. That didn't bother us though. He was there to do a job, get his tips and go home. We ordered drinks first but they weren't that great. I got some type of fruit punch but I can't recall the exact name. It wasn't bad but it wasn't very sweet. They also put a ton of ice in the glass so it only took a few sips before it was gone. My friend ordered the ice tea something or another. She didn't like her drink at all but drank it anyway. The drinks were only $5 and as they say you get what you pay for... I ordered the blackened chicken with collard greens and red beans. It was also served with cole slaw and corn muffins. The chicken was good but it wasn't the best. I didn't even eat a third of it. It seemed to be cooked chicken that was charcoaled on the grill. There was no spicy or southern flavor to it. The collard greens didn't have much flavor. They weren't cooked with smoked turkey like I'm used to so there was something missing. I added salt and pepper but it didn't help much. The red beans and rice were the best part of the meal. I could have gone without the onions and bell peppers but I just pushed them to the side. The cole slaw was too tart for me and not creamy enough so I didn't eat it. The corn muffins were sweet and really good. My friend ordered the fried chicken with spinach and red beans. She liked her food much more then I liked mine. She said the spinach and chicken was really good. Overall, I simply wasn't that impressed. This visit was a reminder of why I've been to Wishbone less than a handful of times over the years.

Business lunch this afternoon.  Hit up Wishbone this afternoon for a nice down home lunch. I was not disappointed at all.  Our server was Omar who was excellent.  The atmosphere is consistent. Conversation, laughter, silverware clinking.  Now, let's get down to the food. I ordered the shrimp and grits and my boy got the brisket with greens, Mac and cheese and mash potatoes with gravy.  The food came out fast and hot. His brisket was delicious (he said it was so good I had to try it with the sauce). My shrimp and cheese grits with bacon was on point. It was simply exactly what I wanted. The only knock I would say was the corn muffin. It was just, eh...  Neither of us ate ours.  The meal was right, the price was right and I certainly will be back!

Great little (big!) spot in Chicago for lunch.  We popped in after our flight arrived, starving, and we're not disappointed.  My grilled chicken, while a little dry, came with an awesome salsa that really brought it up a notch.  Highly recommend the collard greens and cheesy grits! Great hospitality in a casual location.

Was introduced by a friend to try their food and I was blown away. I never ate cornbread with actual corn in it lol. Yes I know it's pretty obvious but I'm used to cornmeal or the other box brands. The blackened chicken smacked me in the face because I didn't expect it to taste that good. They're spinach is second to none and arguably better than my grandmothers. Would recon to others.

I met up with an associate/friend to eat before attending a seminar nearby. It's definitely a casual spot and has a diner feel to it. We were able to seat ourselves and the service was fast, as we mention to our waitress we were on a time constraint. They bring out a complimentary side of mini corn muffins that are delicious! The price of the menu items are quite reasonable. I had Oprah's favorite Cajun Cheese Grits. OMG after coming back from New Orleans I need something southern and this hit the spot! I will definitely be back to have the crab cakes my friend raved about. Solid spot to go to for dinner.

I was visiting family in town and walked by wishbone. I had no idea Chicago had southern food in the area. I was lucky that I was staying close by within walking distance otherwise I'd have to pay metered parking. I ended up going in on my own during the weekday for lunch. Shrimp and grits is my favorite, so it was an easy decision on what to get. Service was quick. The dish itself was really good. Awesome flavors and plenty of shrimp. The portion was pretty big too, so I was able to enjoy a little extra later in the day. If you're close and enjoy good southern food. Go.

I have gone here many times over the years and it has remained consistently good. We tend to go for breakfast more than any other meal. My favorite dish is Shrimp & Grits with bacon and mushrooms (which is also severed at Lunch/Dinner). The grits are creamy and the sauce is very flavorful, and they give you a good amount of shrimp- sometimes restaurants skimp on the shrimp and give your more grits than shrimp. Not here. Other good breakfast choices include the Denver Omelette, Pancakes and Salmon Cakes. The biscuits are also very good.  As mentioned in another review valet parking is pricey-$10 for 0-4 hours when we last dined there, but there are not a lot of parking options available in the area.

The quality of the food was as good as always,  however IDK if it's cuz I ordered through Grub Hub, but the portion sizes of the entrees and sides were WAY SMALLER than when I eat in and when I order carry out.  I"m also not sure if they have changed the size of the corn muffins across the board, but be advised that the once regular size corn muffins are now mini muffins.  When you order in or for carryout, the vegetarian entrees come with 3 dishes whereas on the grub hub menu there's just 1. When I ordered a side of red beans and rice the container was half-full (vs. being completely full when I dine in or order carryout).

Parking is horrible, valet is minimum  $8.00. I would think twice due to these issues! Seated promptly on New Year's Eve afternoon. The place was packed too. I like to see business booming, good sign of good food. We got seated at a cozzy corner table near a window and surprisingly it wasn't cold.  We asked the waiter questions about dishes concerning cheese, pork, & beef because I, nor my friend don't eat those items or things made with them and the server was nonchalant and uncaring about our concerns. So we ordered "safe items" -1 star for his lack luster/busy attitude there. We got shrimp gumbo and shrimp & grits. To me the gumbo was overpriced and not worth it. It was just ok. It had shrimp, chicken, sausage & fish in it. It was more jambalaya ish to me not gumbo ish. I ate most of it. It was served w/a delicious corn muffin. Their mimosas are also nice and tasty too. Not sure I'm interested in returning honestly, nothing on the menu worth running back to try other than my interest in trying the crispy french toast, but I won't rush I'll tell ya that much.

Like this is perhaps one of the best affordable places in Chicago. The food is good and the staff is friendly. I have been there a few times and never had bad service.   Until I made a reservation WEEKS ago for the 26th. I go on their site today just to make sure all is well and these people have closing hours at 3pm. I call like wtf is there a mistake on your site? The lady responds and says no it was a last minute decision so no one checked the damn book to see if there were any reservations huh? Not a call email text nothing! Ridiculous I have a large party attending my birthday event and now I have no restaurant.

Weekend Brunch is where it's at!!! Nothing like my prior Weekday Breakfast experience, Today Wishbone was alive! The weekend menu offers so much more variety. Came in for brunch, party of 3, and it was jammed packed with a 20 to 30 minute wait... Luckily for us a friend suggested to wait at the bar and the moment we sat down we immediately decided the bar would be the best to dine in.  Bartenders were nice, attentive, and made it hard to resist the alcohol! Ordering was quick and easy, our food was delivered quicker than expected. Cheers to a great morning and a delicious brunch!  Totally recommend to experience the weekend vibe, you won't regret it!

I've updated my review to 5 starts because of the exceptional customer service from Wishbone.  I raised some concerns about my last experience and the staff responded quickly and went beyond expectations to resolve the issue.  It's rare to find a restaurant that actually listens, and Wishbone shows it truly cares about its customers.  On a side note, it has some of the best comfort food in Chicago!

My go-to spot when I'm in the mood for something with a little soul. I enjoy most of their sides, especially the corn, greens, and sweet potatoes. Main course wise, their fried catfish, shrimp n grits,and jambalaya are all great. Only thing I wasn't a fan of was their fried chicken. I'm still in the process of trying something new every time I go, but it's really hard to avoid their shrimp n grits. Corn muffin wise, I'm not sure what the hype is all about. To me, it seems a bit dry and I've pretty much stopped eating it when it arrives with my meals.  Oh, I also really like their sweet tea with mini ice cubes. What do you even call this kind of ice? Doesn't matter, I like it.

The food is delicious! The server was amazing despite the craziness and how crowded brunch was. I ordered the crawfish with eggs benedict which was so filling and shared the shrimp and grits with my girlfriend which she absolutely loved. I also liked the shrimp and grits but I thought the cheese might have been a bit too strong for my taste. Overall, loved this place and definitely coming back the next time I'm in town.

I came in for brunch. Tasted the french toast, pancakes, blackened chicken, jambalaya omelet, cheese grits, black beans, corn muffin, fresh fruit side, and black coffee. All nice. Service on a busy Sunday morning was nice. nice.

I was introduced to this location by friends earlier for lunch. I couldn't wait to return for dinner and introduce my girlfriend to the crusted Tilapia meal. Our waiter Ricky Lewis, while handling his tables, ensured our positive return experience. I shall spread the word of this location. I also tried and enjoyed the chicken gumbo too!

The waitress was very nice. But the food was extremely bland. The black beans were undercooked and flavorless. The service was quick and the pricing was $$. The cappuccino was good, nothing special about the Bloody Mary.

Came here for brunch with a few friends and had a pretty good experience! Because this place is very large, there is a minimal wait time, which is key when doing Sunday Brunch in the West Loop neighborhood. Across the street, Little Goat had a 1 hour wait time, so a larger space really helps this place. The service was really good, our server was very nice and came every time we actually needed something, so that was great. The food was decent, not the best thing I've had but far from the worst. It's not as creative as nearby restaurants but it's good southern comfort food. I opted for the red beans and rice, which I thought came with chicken, but it was only flavored with chicken broth. 2 things that are very delicious and made in house are the biscuits and corn muffins, these are offered with almost every entree and they are DELICIOUS. I would come back to this spot and try a new dish next time! Additionally, I would like to say that I was grateful that me and my friends could spend 4 hours here without anyone rushing us out (yes, we were one of those people) but it didn't impact wait time so it was a win-win.

This place isn't bad, but I don't go out of my way to come here. My friends however love it which is way this isn't 2 stars. The food is typical diner food but a little better prepared. Service is always friendly, and we've never had a problem getting a table. With that said, nothing sticks out. Come here for a quick brunch for that hangover.

I've been wanting grits for a while and couldn't think of any where close to us that had grits. Needless to say we were too lazy to make the trek to Edgewater.  We ended up choosing Wishbone for brunch since the reviews mention grits.  Yes, I know, I know the reviews are not so hot and probably would've been better off going to IHOP. However, every time we pass by the place it is always super packed.  The place inside is alright. Super packed with families and people all wanting to get their brunch on.  Keep in mind that you will probably have 2-3 waiters bump into you while running to the kitchen or delivering dishes. The spaces are pretty tight between tables. We opt to sit inside since most places always forget about their outside diners. Our waiter brought us menus then asked us what we want to order. He seemed highly annoyed he had to come to our table let alone ask us what our order is. When we said we needed time since we just got the menu, the waiter rolled his eyes. Whoa there brah! I asked for a coffee while the fiancé asked for water and he comes back with coffee for the fiancé and I. Before we could even say anything he runs off. The entire time dining no one came to refill our drinks once or even ask for refills. Save your 2.50 and get coffee from Starbucks at least it won't taste like charcoal.  The food was as bad as a Tara Reid's acting. My crab cake eggs benedict made my drunk cooking look stellar. The crab cake was the size and thickness of a York Peppermint Patty. Tasted all  like crackers topped with half a tablespoon of hollandaise sauce.  The cheesy grits was a massive bland blob that had one layer of cheese. The fiancé ordered the jambalaya omelet which was a big disappointment too.  We were more excited to get our bill and peace out. Oh wait that is if we could find our waiter. He finally noticed we were done after we kept signaling him.  Instead of taking the plates or asking if we're finished, the waiter stands in front of us looking annoyed and looking everywhere else. He then proceeds to signal us with his hands for us to hand it over to him along with any dishes on our table.

I've been to Wishbone many times and have always had great experiences.  The atmosphere, service, prices and quality of food all make for a really good meal.  Today I got the spinach, mushroom and tomato omelette with feta cheese, which was excellent and totally hit the spot on a rainy, overcast day.  I also recommend the black bean cakes with mango salsa, while a friend I typically go with orders nothing but the red eggs.
Had the brisket. It was dry, but it tasted ok. Did not have dessert, but they looked good!

Once upon a time, Wishbone used to be amazing. Now my disappointment can only be summed up by the salty entrees and Hershey chocolate syrup covered pecan pie. Why oh why did you destroy that lovely pie with Hershey's syrup piled so high?

I had brunch here with a friend on a Saturday morning, and there was no wait.  We were seated outside and able to enjoy the weather!   My plate of wishbone corned beef hash cakes was delicious; I devoured all of its salty goodness quickly.  The cornbread muffin was just okay, a hair on the dry side..   But I'm really appreciative of the breadth and depth of the Southern fare that this place provides, so I will definitely be back! The staff was generous with giving us time to hang out even though we ate our food quickly... In fact, they were TOO generous with their time; we waited what must have been 30 minutes after removing our plates to flag down a waitress to give us a check... But this is not big deal. Will be back!

The service is impeccable. Our server was very friendly, nice and smiley. He deserves every penny of his tips. The way he presents himself, checks on the table makes him a spectacular server!! The outside patio is spacious and not crowded. But next time not choosing a table by the plants. The bees were around a lot.  The food no doubt is still fabulous. The sides were tasty as can be. I had the black bean cakes. Will be back again!!!

I haven't been there in a number of years but the Sunday brunch was great. Fresh eggs, pancakes, potatoes -- as good as momma makes. I always asked for the potatoes a little more crispy, and to do 'em up with grilled onions. Superb.

Tonight was one of the worst dining experiences i have had in awhile.  We got to your establishment about 6:00 pm.  We got there early because we had a show at 7:30 we needed to get to at the United Center.  We placed our order about 6:20 pm.  Ordered fried chicken, shrimp and grits and kids chicken strips.  Others around us ordered about the same time or were sat down close to same time.  As we started to see food coming out of the kitchen we noticed others were getting their food and we were still sitting there.  Looked at the clock it was 6:40 pm.  Asked the server what was going on with our food since others around us were getting theirs. Told me food would be up in a minute 20 mins later we noticed people are done eating and we still have not received our food.  I walked to the server and told her to just cancel my order since the food was still not up. I looked around the restaurant and you were not even crowded and the kitchen looked to be staffed properly for a Saturday night. The manager was standing there all she did was shrug her shoulders never saying sorry for the inconvenience or slow service. At this point the other person with me said lets leave since they don't seem to concerned about it.  The server did not charge us for the 3 drinks we had for the past hour which was tea and two sprites. Not sure what was going on tonight but would have been nice to receive a little more sympathy from management when we waited for 45 mins and had not received any food.
Tasty food. Great decor. Friendly staff. Love it! Crunchy french toast, black bean cake, red omelette, and cheeses grits are tasty!

***This review is for Wishbone Catering! We used Wishbone for our wedding at Promontory Point in Chicago on August 8, 2015. By leaps and bounds Wishbone was the best decision we made during our wedding planning process! I could not have been happier with the service received from everyone at Wishbone. The excellent service began with the first email inquiry sent, to the finishing touches the day of!  Wishbone staff was professional, helpful, caring and efficient!  Here are just some of the many things we loved about our experience! - The tasting was amazing! Viri let us try so many different foods and even let us take everything home! It was awesome and really sealed the deal for us.  - Viri worked with us from the start of the process, almost one year before the event. She was responsive to each and every one of my emails and genuinely cared about my questions and concerns. She would always give me a quick response and I felt so much better having her during the planning process! She was like my own personal wedding coordinator! Thank You Viri!! - The staff (servers, chef, bartender) we had the day of our wedding were such hard workers and really cared about making our day special. Alejandro, who was our catering captain, was absolutely amazing! Every time I asked him something or made a request he was right there with it! I couldn't have been happier having him there that day! He was so great.  - The food is so different and interesting, my guests raved about the menu and drinks (especially the specialty drink- Electric Lemonade!) I was looking for memorable catering and I definitely received it!!!  Overall, Wishbone was worth every penny. I highly recommend them and am so happy that we chose them for our wedding. You will not go wrong! Choose Wishbone Catering!!!!

I ordered beef brisket with barbeque  sauce. The barbeque sauce was a little bit spicy. It also comes with two sides. I got mash potatoes and corn. The service was quick and fast. It was good southern comfort food. Great location in the west loop.

I have been coming here for breakfast for over ten yrs. I live a couple blocks away and think of myself as a regular. Today I came in for the early bird special. To my surprise the price had gone from 3.95 to 5.50. I understand a slight increase for business but to my dismay the quality was awful. Very disappointed in one of my otherwise favorite places.  Hopefully things improve so I can return
Great service, one of the best brunches I ever had, the crab cakes and scramble eggs with cheese were delicious, Mimosa was delectable, and the service was amazing.

While visiting Chicago this past July. A friend took me to Wishbone for brunch to celebrate my birthday. Service was great and the servers were friendly and knew the menu well. I had shrimp and grits And my  dish was delicious.  The food was flavorful and seasoned just right. I will definitely eat there again on my next visit to Chicago.

a trip down to memory lane since i spent a lot of time in this neighborhood, having an art studio nearby in the early 1990's...this place has been around here since then so they are doing something right...good southern style cooking to match the eclectic decor and the playful subject paintings that hang on the walls (good lesson not to do acid while decorating)...leave your suit and tie at home and wear your painting clothes so you can blend in with the atmosphere while you devour some briskets and collard greens...drink some watermelon lemonade...the cheese grits are good but the corn bread is always dry...desserts are also fresh (i recommend the pecan pie if you like it homemade way)...good food portion for the price...parking is difficult to find in the area so you best just use the valet...

This was not my first time and won't be my last. I love that Wishbone has a casual feel but still puts a lot into their brunch. I had the crawfish cakes and grits. If you like a good southern cooked meal in the midwest, I definitely recommend trying this place out.
Cajun inspired breakfast food prepared incredibly well. This is on my list of restaurants I have to come back to everytime I am in Chicago.

Passed this place for years and I never really noticed it. Stopped in yesterday for lunch with a friend of mine and I was impressed the macaroni and cheese was delicious and so were the collard greens. I will definitely be back for more of the buttermilk fried chicken.

Unpretentious reliable and tasty neighborhood brunch spot. No wait no hipsters. The blueberry pancakes and southern Benedict are fantastic. Fresh squeezed OJ and solid coffee. Very underrated in my opinion.

We came here for breakfast. The other three people I was with I think liked their food only ok, but I am giving it a solid 4 stars because they served up excellent, excellent biscuits and gravy. Which is all a breakfast restaurant needs. Further points because this is the first decent sausage gravy I've had up here in the yankee north. Most places seem to think gravy should be the consistency and color of dirty rainwater. Wishbone, being southern style cooking, recognizes that it should creamy, peppery, chock full of zesty sausage chunks, and so thick it can barely be classified as a liquid. Well done.
Absolutely love this place! Everything I've had on the menu was great. Usually pretty busy on the weekend. Reasonably priced
They have thee best shrimp and grits!!  If you are looking for a great place to bring an out of town guest for a taste of Chicago, this is an awesome spot.

I've been coming to Wishbone for many, many years and still in love! My favorites are shrimp and grits, sautéed spinach, cole slaw, salmon cakes and blackened catfish. It's always consistent and the customer service is fantastic! Love the staff!

I always drive by and it catches my attention to stop in. I finally stopped in for my birthday dinner last night and had the buttermilk fried chicken with mac and cheese and smashed sweet potato.Very very delicious, I look forward to going again!

Saturday brunch was great.  We had a short wait for an outside table.  The menu is gloriously brief but offers a wide array of tastes to suit every appetite.  The food came out fast, hot and delicious.  That should be the norm but think about how often that actually happens for breakfast/brunch food. The service was efficient and Al the staff seem to enjoy working there.  The Bloody Mary is my favorite drink here, very spicy and peppery but very good.  It's a signature spot among restaurant row.

It's been over 5 years since I visited.  Believe back then they used to also have cafeteria style service.  Wanted to have an omelette but succumbed to gut instinct and tried one of their daily specials the chicken fried steak.  Unfortunately the cut of meat wasn't the best.  However, it was prepared and cooked well.  The two sides that I selected, sauteed spinach and black beans and rice, was fine.  I would certainly come back but order something else.

The wait staff was VERY, VERY friendly. Answered all my questions about the food, made food and drink recommendations, and was always smiling. The food was reasonably priced (especially for the West Loop) and tasted delicious. Drinks were great. The only reason it didn't get 5 stars is our wait time for a table. They weren't full (three empty tables outside), but it took a while for someone to seat us and for our waiter to arrive once we were seated.

Went here on a friends recommendation. I lived in New Orleans so I am used to good southern cooking. I didn't really expect to find it in Chicago. I had the crawfish cakes. Outstanding!!!! The cheese grits were the best I have ever had. The busy it was cooked to perfection. I tried my friends shrimp and grits which will be the bar for which I measure all shrimp and grits in the future. My other friend had the corned beef hash which he said was the best he has ever had. All and all a perfect meal. Highly recommend.
This is some  of  the best restaurant food  i have had in years.   Tastes like home made, and this  comes from a passionate foodie!  I will make this  my regular stop while in the west loop area.

This place is my thang! Love going here on weekends for mimosas, coffee, and the shrimp and grits or the salmon cakes. Lovely environment and love the customer service. Everyone is super sweet and attentive. I've been to this location and the one up north and while they both are good, there is something about this location that makes the food taste better and the environment feel warmer.
