I finally went to check out this restaurant for my birthday, it was an okay experience. I didn't care for the cornbread muffins.  My catfish and sauteed spinach was very good. The price on the entire menu is very inexpensive. Even though they were understaffed due to a city event,  they don't offer free dessert for bdays I have never seen that. The waiter was really friendly and nice but somehow charged my mother-in-law an extra $10 on her debit card even though we gave him cash and didn't write a tip on the receipt.

Family and I dined in wishbone last friday and lets just say the food was phenomenal. Elizabeth made our night remarkable she went on and beyond to satisfy my taste buds, noting that I cant consume any sugar or gluten. Two thumbs up, keep it up wishbone i will definitely be back soon.

Southern style breakfast as it should be done! The jambalaya omelette is really good and the cornbread is also top notch.  Service is good and attentive but they do get busy from time to time so make reservations or plan ahead. Overall, great southern food at a reasonable price.

Very cute place for Southern-inspired breakfast. We were seated quickly and the server got our orders quickly, nicely reminding us that breakfast is over at 11. Coffee was kind of weak, but the orange juice was fresh squeezed and delicious!   I had the corncakes with eggs over medium (they came out more over easy), which were delicious.  The red pepper sauce was really creamy and good. My boyfriend got the shrimp and grits with bacon hesitantly at the server's recommendation, which were really good. Surprisingly light and flavorful.  Great prices for the food! I'd recommend it.

Super cute place, fantastic service - several people stopping by to check on us. All day breakfast huge plus (and tasty); pulled pork very yummy, Brussels sprouts and mashed sweet potatoes good.  Great drink selection, and large outdoor seating area. Definitely recommend
Food and service was good... Love the fact of liquor for breakfast...lol!! But the only drawback place seemed cramped... Tables on top of you...its pretty loud on weekend for sure
Typical southern American brunch, which means big portion, lots of cheese. It tastes good but also very unhealthy, so worth trying once in a while but not on a frequent bassi.

I dined at Wishbone about four or five times and I have always had a great experience from the excellent food to the excellent customer service. The last time I dined there, a waitress named Ariel treated my good friend and I exceptionally well. Her welcome was warm and we were taken care of the entire time. No matter how good a restaurant's food is, customer service is very important as that is the icing that keeps me wanting to come back and wanting to spread the word. All of my expectations were fully met!!!

I dined at Wishbone with a large group at lunchtime. They were gracious and seated us all in the same area of the restaurant. I ordered breakfast, since that is my favorite meal, the fresh spinach omelet.  It was absolutely delicious!  I added bacon and ordered grits and toast.  It was great!  I ordered the coconut cake to take home to enjoy later.  Everyone at my table enjoyed their lunch.

Looking for a place to eat with your dog on a rainy day?  This might be the best option around.  Need a simple breakfast joint easy on the wallet?  This fits the bill as well. An over protective dog friend was shlepping his dog around for the day, attached to his hip.  And it was pouring rain, and we were hungry.  Wishbone allows dogs on the huge patio, we were well protected from the rain and everyone had a decent breakfast.  I like that this place is not too hip, too expensive, or too complicated.  They make their grits the old school way - just water, much appreciated.  They have overly sugary desserts that cost $4 for a slice of cake.  How retro.  When was the last time I had a piece of cake for $4?  A good place to bring families too.

Had to visit, always see this place on TV. We visited on a Sunday around 1130. There was no wait to sit outside, but didn't have to wait long although we wanted to sit inside. I ordered a delicious dish of shrimp and grits which came with a biscuit. Server was not as attentive as I'd prefer because I didn't get my biscuit initially and I was out of coffee. But overall a good experience based solely on my dish. See the picture I posted, it received a lot of likes on Facebook and Instagram ahahaha.

Came in here for brunch two weeks ago, and was blown away. I love cajun and southern food, and this place does it right on all aspects, from the food, to the drinks, to the service. Walking in on a Saturday morning, it was a bit crowded and we didn't have a reservation, but the space is so large we didn't have to wait more than five minutes to be seated. I asked my friend who frequents this place what to order, and she responded with "just get any of the cakes". She was not wrong. I ordered the crawfish cakes with cheesy grits on the side, she got the crab cakes and our friend got the spicy black bean cakes. We all shared and all were amazing, perfect blend of cajun and smoky seasonings on all. Grits were perfectly cooked as well, and trust me, they can be gross if they're cooked improperly. Some of our other friends got the chicken andouille hash and eggs benedict, all of which looked mouthwatering. I ordered the Mr. Funky drink and our other friends ordered the hurricane, and front porch tea. My only cricitism of the meal was my drink. The Mr. Funky (which I ordered solely based on the name) was cranberry juice, champagne, and something else, but it basically tasted like Hawaiin punch. I ordered the front porch tea instead for my second drink, and it was way better (their own homemade peach moonshine with iced tea). I noticed behind the bar that they had rows and rows of jars of homemade moonshine in probably 20 flavors. The peach one I had was excellent, and it added to the cool vibe of the restaurant. Even though this place is kind of out of the way in the West Loop, I will definitely be returning for brunch. Great drinks, and some of the best Southern cajun food I've had in the city.
Horrible experience. They lost our reservation for brunch on Mother's Day for 15 people & we're very rude. Never will go back again!!

Incredibly disappointing!!  Called several weeks in advance and made reservations for 15 people  ...showed up to be told no reservations existed and the wait would be at least an hour+!!!  Needless to say  we will not be back!!!!  Very very poorly run and handled!!!!!!

We dined here for lunch. Parking is insane, but the restaurant is pretty cool. I had the salmon cakes, cornbread, mac and cheese with rice and beans. I definitely want to go back and try different things on their menu. The salmon cakes were not what I usually eat and it was a different variation of how I make them, but still very tasty.

First time at this local looking restaurant, and I was somewhat impressed. Looking over the menu I was happy to see that many of the ingredients were locally sources.  I was quite disappointed that the server took down my order incorrectly, and then failed to return the remaining 30 minutes we were there until he brought the check (which he was very quick to pick up when we paid).  Overall, would go again and hope for a different server so I could have my meal the way I hoped for.

I met a friend here recently for lunch and I was happy with the service and food there.    I have been to the one on Lincoln many times and know that that one is very kid friendly.  Luckily, this location is too.  I had my young son with me.   We found parking on the street right across the street and were seated very quickly despite it being the lunch rush.  They give crayons and coloring menu to keep the little ones busy (awesome!!).  I had (and always have) the corn cakes with over easy eggs.  They are so delicious!  I can't order anything else from Wishbone because...well why???   My son had pancakes with peaches and mixed fruit.  Their kid meal was a huge portion and very reasonable pricewise.  He enjoyed it.   My friend had catfish and mac and cheese (my son ate half so he definitely approved).   She said their catfish is the absolute best.

Great brunch idea for wife and kids...portions were fantastic and the speed with which our food came to table was excellent.  I had crunchy French toast, biscuits and gravy (outta this world!), and cheese grits.  Good lawd!  Now it's time for my nap.  Oh yes, coffee to start was exceptional.  This is a keeper in my book!

Food was great.   I would rate it 4 stars.   The problem is when you park your car with the valet.   The valet lost our car and then had the audacity to say it was our fault.  We waited for over 20 minutes!   Then the valet told us that we should park our car on the street.  So, I would rate the valet with 1 star.

Wishbone is not the type of restaurant I would normally visit but a friend took me and after trying it once I was hooked. They offer excellent southern style cuisine with a new flair to the meal. The shrimp and grits is excellent as well as the salmon cakes. Every meal I have there has been exceptional nothing but good things to say and I love the atmosphere very downtown-ish.

Initial impression was a contrast to what my mind thought up. The name, and location, were the only thing I knew, so the vision vs reality were a stark difference. That being said, it was a remarkable dinner, with delicious southern dishes, incredible cornbread (yes, I ate the bread!) and reasonable pricing.  If you're ever venturing in the area, this is not a date night special. I had dreamt up a steak house, with rich wood and low lighting, this place is quite the opposite. Colorful, farm patterns, poodles on the walls, 1/2 booth tables..... A unique ambiance given the row of high end restaurants one street over. The menu was small, with vegetarian specials, daily specials, and the largest side dish menu ever, with additional side dish specials that change weekly. Everything had a southern flare, so naturally, I ordered what I presume to be THE staple southern dish : jambalaya (with shrimp). Boy, was I happy I did. The photo doesn't do it justice. The shrimp were incredibly well seasoned, great texture, to the meat and broth, and yes, this food had soul, and a little heat, to warm your heart. It was a relaxed atmosphere, and given there were 8 of us, the perfect place to meet, eat, and enjoy without the pretentiousness of Randolph's restaurant row. I dabbled some into my friends dishes, all were similar in that they were delicious. Cooked with love, and lard, and smothered in thick, flavorful sauces. Our waiter was great, checked back frequently, made us laugh, and added to the experience. Plus, outdoor seating area (currently closed, cause spring still thinks it winter) must make this s go to spot when it's warm. So go- and leave amy dietary restrictions at home. Feed your soul, without draining your wallet, and bring the entire group.

I love the shrimp and grits and the coffee is always hot and continuously poured. Since I usually visit on the weekends, the crowd is pretty thick and parking is usually found after a couple trips around the block. Parking is free in the area on Sunday.

Really disappointed about the business end of wishbone. Bought a groupon. Found out it is only valid during the week. Finally get a day off during the week we can actually use the groupon. Wishbone decided to close the week of Jan 26-30th. Waste of our money. We can't even use it and they will not accommodate any alterations.  Food is usually great, environment has a cool vibe. If we ever get to go back with the rip off groupon, I guess it will be good.

Wishbone Wishbone Ooh How I Love Thee.. My affair with Wishbone goes back to my college days when a promoter would host an event entitled "The breakfast club" at Wishbone when the nightclub closed and that's when I had my first taste of the food of Wishbone which drew my antennas to revisit during normal business hours to try other menu items. Man ooh Man was I in for a treat with the menu items and the Southern charm involved with the preparation of the menu items. The staff is full of life from the servers to the bar backs to the clean up crew. Once you approach this corner gem on Washington you are greeted by valet which prices vary depending on the time you arrive. It's a little cheaper before 10am I believe about a $3 difference. There is indeed street parking but GOOD LUCK with that and Enjoy paying the people who brought the city of Chicago parking meters with a ridiculous hourly rate (still less than valet, but I'm quick to valet if there isn't an immediate space available in view). My Fav items: Shrimp n Grits (No Bacon-I don't eat pork) Salmon cakes  Home Fries Blacken Catfish Ultimate Mimosa French Toast Wishbone is a MUST DO when I'm home in Chicago for brunch, believe me you don't be sorry.

I ordered delivery through Grubhub from this restaurant and to my surprise it arrived in less than 40 min.  I ordered the smoke beef brisket that had 2 sides; home fries with garlic and onions & sautéed green beans, pulled pork plate that had 2 sides; macaroni and cheese & home fries with garlic, crawfish cakes that had 2 sides; mashed sweet potatoes & cole slaw, and house salad.  Everything was perfectly packaged and edible. It's not the best I have ever had, but it was good hence 4 our of 5 stars. Will definitely order again..
Best(est) corn muffins ever! Great service, casual ambiance and yummy selection of sides.

Came for a quick wkend getaway & our hosts recommended Wishbone. This place was great & service was awesome! Our party was 5 adults & 5 kids and our waiter handled it with ease. I had the blackened catfish, my only complaint was it was not enough! Everything that everyone had at our table was great...shirmp/grits pancakes platter french toast.

We made reservations- It's a mighty big family. And you know what?  This one is allergic. That one will not eat carbs. Over there? Gluten-free. Vegan, vegetarian and all present.  "I don't eat citrus!" Said another.  Yessiree Alrighty.  Everyone is here for brunch!  A staff ready to handle all demands, substitutions and special accommodations like pros, instead of running for the hills cursing and weeping (which would be my first inclination).  I had coffee which was kept brimming the entire time- given my consumption this is remarkable. Also had yummy orange juice. Don't miss the remarkable Crab Cakes Benedict- rich and delightful. Much like the above and beyond brunch service here.

I love Wishbone! They have great food for inexpensive prices. I recently brought my boyfriend here for dinner after we went climbing at a new climbing gym in the west loop. We have gone twice now for dinner and are planning on making a weekly visit after we climb. We love their rolls and cornbread muffins! They are incredibly moist and delicious and they will give you as much as you want! Each time we have gone we have ordered different dishes. I love the herb crusted tilapia with sauteed spinach and acorn squash as the sides. They also have a very good jumbalaya which is perfect on cold nights. Parking in the area is free on the street and is typically not too difficult to find. This restaurant is never crowded when we go (7:30-8:00 pm) on a weeknight. We have always had good service when we have gone and it's been fairly quite and a nice place to relax and have a good meal after working out!

It was only OK.  The food was delicious, but the overall experience was just meh.  I made a reservation, and STILL had to wait 20 minutes to be seated.  She said they were behind on reservations.  I don't even know what that means.  The shrimp and grits were awesome.  Would definitely order them again.
It took 30 minutes to get my omelette.  I ordered it without cheese, and it came filled with cheese.   I gave up and left.  The food can be good here, but they need to get their act together.

Scrumptious!! Ok so I've only had one thing here and that's one thing only that I can vouch for and that's their yummy and filling Shrimp and Grits breakfast special. Oh lawdy lawdy! This $10 holla meal comes with a biscuit or corn muffin, I prefer corn muffin along with a hot bowl of shrimp and grits with mushrooms and bacon sprinkled lightly!!! Now this place is not stingy with there shrimp that's for certain, which makes you enjoy every shrimp filled bite. The creamy sauce I'm not sure what it is but makes every scoop well worth it. If your hungry and in the West Loop with only a few coins to spare I say pull up at table at Wishbone! Fast service and quick seating. It's finger licking good! A+

We visited Wishbone on a busy Friday evening and began our meal with a Seafood Chowder which was very good.  For entrees we had: 1.  Shrimp and grits  2.  Blackened catfish with sides of mac and cheese and mashed sweet potatoes  3.  Salmon cakes with sides of collard greens and red beans and rice. About 1/4 of the way through the entrees I said to myself......... 'dis ain't nothin' but soul food..........probably cooked by Mexicans'. No offense to my Chicano brothers, but, how would you like to go to the local Taqueria and see Ray-Ray nem' in the kitchen?   All of the food was pretty tasteless.  The shrimp and grits dish was decent but nothing special.  They bring it out on one of those huge plates that has a round center about 1/4 inch deep that makes it look like you're getting a lot, but you're really not.  The red beans and rice was pretty much rice with chopped tomatoes on top and about 8 beans (and flavorless).  Mac n cheese? Tasteless.  Greens.....meh.  The salmon cakes were really a soul food dish called salmon croquettes, and tasted like nothing more than canned salmon formed into a round patty.   Our server had a very pleasant demeanor but we only saw her once after she brought the food.  We had to flag down other workers to get a refill of water (which we never got) and condiments.  Another server brought the check but never came back, so we just paid at the register and left.   I was surprised with how unimpressed I was with the food with the exception of the soup.  My wife felt the same way.  This place seems very popular, but I don't get it.  Two and a half stars.

Quick update review of a true Chicago treasure: Today I dashed in just after 2, only 15 minutes before an appointment at nearby Family Barbershop. Sadly the cafeteria side had closed & they were finishing putting away their food. But confirming the tradition of Wishbone's excellent service, a young lady named Quinn stopped cleaning up & asked what I wanted. She immediately served me delicious jambalaya. I was able to eat a very tasty, hearty cost effective lunch in less than 10 minutes!  So kudo's again to Wishbone's for hiring, training & retaining customer service superstars like Quinn (and also a huge thanks to whoever makes the jambalaya too!!)!

Good food, some of the service needs improvement. Also, there are 3-4 menus, when 1 main one with all items would be easier to follow. Didn't even see appetizers being offered. Louisiana cooking and NO FRIED GEEEN TOMATOES, in sight. #WTF

My husband and I got married recently and used Wishbone as our caters. Boy, was that a smart decision on our part! Viri and her team were outstanding and handled everything from ordering linens, to setting our ceremony chairs to carving delicious brisket on the spot for our guests. We couldn't be happier with how smoothly everything went. They truly kicked butt.  Our menu consisted of brisket, black bean cakes with mango salsa, salad, mac n' cheese, corn bread, sweet potatoes, stuffed zuchinni and chicken po'boys. The food was even more delicious than we remember it being at our tasting and I saw nearly every guest go back for seconds. Not to mention the numerous conversations I overheard throughout the night of folks talking about how delicious the food was, which just made my heart smile. My husband's niece even said, "I'm a huge brisket snob, and this stuff just melts in your mouth. Some of the best brisket I've ever had." Sounds like a win to me.  And the service was out of this world, too. Wishbone's staff was friendly, attentive and just a general blast to have around. They periodically checked in with my husband and I to make sure everything was to our liking, but they weren't over-bearing about it. Truly excellent! If you're looking for caters who are easy to work with, affordable, but not cheap in taste or style I guarantee you won't be disappointed. Thanks Viri and Wishbone. We're so glad you were a part of our big day!

I was a huge fan of the Lakeview Wishbone when I used to live there and am now delighted to know there is a Wishbone near my new 'hood as well. Two groupons later, one for breakfast and one for dinner, and I can happily report that it's just as good as the other one. For breakfast, I got my standard crunchy french toast because I love it- and how could I not with this corn flake covered sweet delight? My only sadness at this time was that they were out of fruit bread. But that's like my favorite thing ever. I would eat loaves of it at a time if I could. For dinner, I tried the pulled pork platter with the BoneBQ sauce and brussels sprouts and mac n cheese as my sides. Yep, cleaned my plate. Totally delicious and crave-worthy comfort food. Is it full of the most unique amazing flavor I've ever had? No, but that's not what this restaurant is all about. Come here when you want simple food done right and your belly needs a warm hug, and that's exactly what you'll get.

I've been coming to Wishbone for years. Over the last couple years I've witnessed the service slowly decline in quality. In the past, service was key from the top down. We would get a warm greeting as we entered and the staff was very inviting.  Today I brought my daughters here for breakfast and I must say, I was shocked. Our waitress was great (only reason I gave it two stars instead of one) but then we had a minor issue with hair in my daughter's fruit bowl. Not a big deal, we just asked if we could get a new bowl. The waitress informed us that the manager would be bringing it out. Now... Hair in food is like the cardinal sin for any restaurant, and I could be posting about that, but I also understand things happen. What I did have a problem with is how the incident as handled by the manager. We were told the manager would bring the new bowl of fruit out. After 5 minutes, still no fruit. I want to reiterate, the waitress was great. She asked me if the manager brought the fruit out. After I told her no, a few more minutes passed and a woman who I'm guessing was the manager, brought a bowl of fruit to us. She was originally handing it to me, I then said, "no, this is for her." She just dropped the bowl on the table and walked away. No words no nothing. Almost like she had an attitude.  Here's where the complaint comes in. If I'm waiting on a "manager" to bring me a bowl of fruit after hair was discovered in the original bowl, I'm kind of expecting an apology, especially since we waited an additional 7-8 minutes for our replacement bowl of fruit. But more so, I certainly don't want to feel guilty because I complained about a hair in my food. Okay... Might seem a bit petty. But as someone that frequents restaurants regularly, service is the one element an establishment can control. When the service is poor from the top down, that's a display of how an establishment values their clients. This was clear indication that their management isn't at all concerned about service, which enough reason for me to not return.  Breakfast/Brunch restaurants in Chicago is a competitive market. It only takes one good or bad review to lose a whole circle of people (potential clients).

Everything about this place is a YES. Weird art on the walls, killer breakfast and lunch menus -- they have EVERYTHING. Have had the tacos as well as the southern style breakfast. This is good eatin' if you're looking for a breakfast/brunch/lunch place. Can't wait to go back!

I'm not a brunch person and typically dread when anyone recommends it. I like that they have a patio, our waiter was nice, and parking was not too hard to find, but the food was pretty underwhelming. Not sure I'd recommend or return.

Some of the best breakfast I've had in Chicago.  Great southern style breakfast. Reasonable price. It was pretty busy when we went, but we were seated in a decent amount of time and the service was timely. Will definitely come back!

From the moment I walked in the service was fantastic. I was seated with my group and immediately greeted by our waiter. Our food arrived shortly after,and it was delicious. The presentation was wonderful and the portions were generous. I'll definitely be a frequent customer. Great job!

YAY! I'm a fan.. yes!  Simple southern style food and near us even better!  I'm sure I'm coming back for brunch here again!    Sweet tea, blackened catfish cheesy grits biscuits!!  Does not get any better and for the price points,  awesome!!  The only thing I would say was lacking? ( Would be the server.. as he didn't have a lot to add past the basic menu descriptions themselves)  he was friendly enough though and for the  prices and the tasty food I'll give that a pass.. for now anyways..just thinking of those red beans and rice...YUM! Still a fan..came back past weekend 10.18.14. the food.. so glad that the food really is consistently good.. this time.. the shrimp/grits and those red beans and rice are still the best I've had in very long time.. also consistent apparently, the service. (another server) nothing welcoming about her at all. Very much letting us know that she was not ever. gonna. smile. which would be fine if she hadn't been somewhat rude as well..it's a good thing the food here is so good!

Wishbone is a solid, standard place.  I've been to the westside location a number of times and always get the black bean cakes.  Wishbone, thank you for this vegan option.  Today I met a friend for lunch and thought I'd try the veggie burger for a change of pace.  Surprise, surprise!  It was a black bean cake on a bun.  It was tasty as always, but a tad dry. The home fries were solid but a little skimpy on the portion.  Our server was super friendly and the service was great.  It was a nice day to enjoy the patio.  I love the down-home atmosphere here.  Again, it's a solid place.

Oh man. This place is delicious. Stopped in on a Saturday for brunch. Shared some biscuits and gravy with my brunch partner and also tried the French toast. Both were amazing. Prices were really fair. Service was meh. But that's okay. The food totally made up it!!!

Wow this place really hit the spot after a workout in millennium park! My friend decided we needed to get brunch after zumba. No argument from me. So we went here because it was close and served booze.   We sat outside and people watched. We got to seat ourselves outside which I loved. Our sever was prompt and got to us right away even though they were pretty busy. I ordered a pretty spicy bloody Mary. Not the best I've had but it was pretty good. My friend made me order the shrimp and grits because she said it was a must have for my first visit. They sounded amazing so once again no argument here. She ordered the biscuits and gravy. Our food came out and baaaaayyyyyybbbbbeeeeeeee it was all over but the shouting! That food was so damn good!  I mean that was the best plate of shrimp and grits I've ever had. And I make a pretty damn mean shrimp and grits but this was something else! And her biscuits and gravy were so good I wanted to slap the waiter! I mean my goodness!  I don't usually get to brunch so this was an awesome treat!

I use to go to the Lincoln Park location eons ago.  Mostly for Sunday brunch.  Because hell what's better than southern cooking on a Sunday morning after a hard night!  Ok maybe tacos but I like to class it up sometimes. Anyway, I digress - we went for a Friday night dinner and they didn't disappoint.  Gotta say they are still as consistent as they were back then.  Wish they'd add more items to their menu.  The blackened catfish was blackened and the jambalaya was hotter than a mutha'.  No bones about it - I know corny! - Wishbone is a Chicago mainstay and I'm for one I'm glad it is still around.
Went here for breakfast because I had a Groupon. The waitress became quite inattentive once she realized I was a Groupon customer. The food was just ok, not amazing.

Groupon brought us there and I wouldn't have known this place is THAT good if the wonderful technology didn't exist!  Based on many yelpers' suggestions, I ordered the shrimp grits with bacon.  It was DELICIOUS.  It was comforting and fattening at the same time (saying that in a positive way).  I missed my grits since I used to live in South Carolina for awhile.  My hubby ordered the peppercorn steak.  It was ok, and I bet there're some better items in the menu that are just as good as my grits.  The service was attentive.  The exterior didn't seem to be "southern" and the food wasn't looking "down and dirty" southern food from what I used to experience while living in SC.  However, it was tasty and tasty food will satisfy my needs whether or not the food is authentic or fusionic.  The location is conveniently located within two (2) blocks of Morgan green/pink line, so it wasn't too hard of a trip coming from the northwest side of Chicago.  The neighborhood is quite and charming so at night it's quite enjoyable sitting in the patio (even though we didn't choose to do).  Surely we will be back when we get a chance.

I went for a Sunday brunch and the place was absolutely packed. With a group of 5 we only had to wait for maybe 10-15 minutes. This is a good place to go with a last minute group without making a reservation. All of the servers seemed friendly and our waters and coffees were never empty. There was a diverse menu with many side options accommodating all different tastes. I think it would be hard to bring someone here and have them not find something they would enjoy. I did scan the menu and take note that there was no fried chicken and waffles option! There are also lots of cute shops and ice cream parlors nearby for a day trip to Chicago's West Loop.

What kind of Southern restaurant doesn't have chicken fried chicken?!? I realize that different parts of the South specialize in different dishes, but as someone from Louisiana, raised in Alabama, who has lived in Mississippi and Texas, and has family in Tennessee and North Carolina, I was not convinced that this is really a "Southern soul food" place. We enjoyed it, but c'mon. Make sure that chicken fried chicken (or steak), fried okra, fried green tomatoes are all on the menu and *then* say you're a real Southern restaurant. The interior of the place was fun, our waitress was very sweet and helpful. It's located a bit out of the way for us, but we would come back if ever in the area.

I worked at Harpo, which is one block away, for several years so visits to Wishbone were frequent.  Sometimes twice in one day so I am familiar with their breakfast, lunch and dinner options.  The food is delicious. comforting and filling.  I wasn't vegetarian then either so I have tried pretty much everything on their menu.  Now I am vegan, but my family is not, and I still love coming to Wishbone.  They have several yummy vegan options for me and non vegan or vegetarian for anyone who choses otherwise.  Very reasonably priced too and so kid friendly.
The food is good! I love their crunchy French toast! Dog friendly for dog walkers! However their Bloody Mary isn't the greatest...

Friendly staff, consistently good food fir a reasonable price & they have valet parking.  I like the fish tacos, black bean cakes, salmon cakes & bloody Mary's, as well as mimosas.  ps, good biscuits & they have good shrimp & grits

Excellent brunch spot. We went there for brunch and was amazed with the flavors. Cheese grits are a must to order!!!  I had the breakfast burrito and was extremely impressed. - good ole southern food.

I can't remember the last time I had a meal so flavorful as the food served at Wishbone. There is truly something for everyone here. The jambalaya is one of the best meals I've ever had and is clearly a labor of love. Wishbone is very reasonably priced and I have never had to wait to be seated or served. Highly recommended.

We got married on June 7, 2014 and used Wishbone Restaurant as the caterer for our big day. Because we had our reception at a Chicago Park District location (South Shore Cultural Center) we had to choose our caterer from a list of approved vendors provided by the city. We met with four or five caterers that fell within our budget. Although several of the caterers we tried seemed to offer the quality we were looking for, we ultimately were swayed by the unique food selections at Wishbone that tend toward Southern cooking.  The primary catering coordinator who we worked with was Viri Anguiano. Viri was extremely attentive and accommodating throughout the entire planning process. It took us several tastings to put together the perfect menu and Viri welcomed us back every time to make sure that we would be completely happy with our choices. This included tastings for appetizers, dinner, dessert, and even cocktails and wine.  Viri also responded to all of our questions and concerns very quickly. Even though we did not use a wedding coordinator, we were very comfortable entrusting all the details to Wishbone on the day of the wedding. And everything turned out to be amazing! Our dinner buffet included smoked brisket, bbq chicken, smashed potatoes, among other sides, and everything was great. We are still getting compliments from guests on the food quality! The bartenders from Wishbone were also great and it was never difficult getting a drink. The catering captain for the day of the event was Alejandro. Although we met him later in the process, he too was so accommodating. The whole Wishbone team was just wonderful in every way! I would highly recommend using Wishbone to cater your wedding if you are looking for great food and an equally great team to help plan for your special event. Even though we chose from a list of approved vendors, I would recommend working with Wishbone, even outside of those constraints.   Thank you, Wishbone, for everything!

Soul food - plain and simple. The wait times are crazy on Sundays, yet wonderfully light on weekdays. Breakfast is the only reason I go, and my oh my, is it good! The service is always professional and friendly, and the take-out line for lunch is rather efficient/interesting if you're in a hurry. The full bar is great for early-morning cure-all drinks with Mary, and the corn bread is memorable.

Went for lunch and was absolutely disgusted. The fact that there were 3 couples in the restaurant should have been a sign. It was EMPTY. The best, and only good part of the meal was the cornbread. The Mac n cheese was OLD. Not fresh, not even made-the-same-morning fresh, like yesterday or day before Mac. Who messes up Mac n cheese?! The fried chicken was DRY. Needed water to swallow. I'm pretty sure someone chewed my coleslaw and regurgitated it onto my plate, sorry to be brash, but I need to paint the picture of how horrible this place is. The greens were OK. I couldn't even get thru half of my plate, it was that bad. I won't be surprised when this once popular restaurant closes down. I wouldn't feed my dog this food.

Quickly becoming a Chicago favorite. Salmon cakes perfect, crab cakes perfect, grits perfect, coffee perfect, cornbread perfect... Love this spot. My wife and I took a friend there for her birthday, she's been back there two days straight.

I ordered their Spinach Omelet with a side of potatoes,  and their gluten free English muffin,  and I must say delicious!  I got Swiss cheese on my Omelet and it was so good.  The potatoes come with cooked onions,  and are very well seasoned.  I am not into gluten free,  however the gluten free English muffin is so good, surprisingly very tasty.

My office went to Wishbone for lunch yesterday to celebrate Juneteenth with "southern reconstructionist food" and we were all very happy.   The decoration is kitschy and cute.  My favorite piece was a poster of a cartoon turkey with an American Flag as a cape. The service was very good - our waters were never empty and the food came out pretty quickly for a larger group.  Our waitress checked in with us several times after she brought everything out. To start, I got a watermelon lemonade to drink and it was seriously good; I had to actively prevent myself from drinking all of it before my meal arrived. There are two vegan options on the menu (without making any deletions or substitutions)- I went with the black bean cakes with mango salsa.  This came with vinegary coleslaw, a corn muffin, and two sides, for which I chose sauteed spinach and fruit.  Everything was very good.  The flavors in the black bean cakes were awesome.  They were perhaps just a touch dry, but a couple dashes of Louisiana hot sauce and the mango salsa took care of that wonderfully.  The spinach was lemony and good.  The coleslaw was also nice, crunchy and fresh.  The corn muffin was moist and I ate it as kind of a pseudo-dessert with the fruit when I was done with everything else.  I was VERY full and it felt like a good amount of food for $10.  I've definitely paid more for less food. My two coworkers sitting next to me got a catfish po'boy and shrimp gumbo.  Both thought their food was good as well, though one said the gumbo would have been a little too bland had she not added a dozen or so dashes of hot sauce. Overall, I would recommend Wishbone to others and I definitely look forward to going back.
The best breakfast in my neighborhood.  I don't have time to review, the stars say it all.

Amazing brunch selections.  Great place to hold business brunch meetings.  You'll find a mixture of casual diners and professionals.  Parking can be challenging.  The food is well worth the challenge.

Sunday morning brunch is a great intro to Wishbone.  They definitely know what they're doing with the classic southern breakfast fare: grits, biscuits and gravy, chicken fried steak and eggs.   The Bloody Mary was no frills, but solid - if a little on the spicy side (I'm a good way). Service was a little lopsided - in a rush all at the beginning, and then nowhere to be found after the food came, but that could have just been our server. Can't wait to explore more of their menu.

Grits, corn bread,  blacken chicken! !! Best place for southern cuisine in Chicago! This place is super busy but we did not wait long. We stopped by on a Sunday afternoon with a party of 8 and were seating within 5 minutes.  Fast service and super friendly staff. I especially like the freshly squeezed watermelon lemonade.

After years of good food, it may be time to say GOODBYE to Wishbone.  I went there on Sunday for the famous shrimp and grits dish.  I'm sad to report that my shrimp were undercooked and the grits were not seasoned well.  My friend's crab crakes were horrible.  They use too much breading as filler.  The coffee was good, but tasted watered down.  I hope that they can bring back the ambience and the tasty food.  Until I hear otherwise, I will not return.
Wishbone has an extensive menu which caters to all foodies.  I was a huge fan of the macaroni and cheese and the Veggie Hoe Cakes. You will not be disappointed.
Incredible Southern comfort food, with fantastic veggie options! The veggie cakes were phenomenal. 'Nuff said.

Went to Wishbone twice during my week long conference in Chicago.  They make no effort to sell pretentious food, or to even suggest the place is high end - which I appreciate. Nice to hit a local "diner" with solid comfort food.  Was shocked to see such an emphasis on southern and cajun cuisine - and that they did it relatively well.  Service was fantastic, each time I went. I found the staff to be warm and friendly.  Prices were easy on the wallet and encouraged me to come back another time.

I've been here for brunch many times and the service and food have always been good. Even when arriving on short notice with a very large group, they have been extremely accommodating.  Most recently Andrea handled a group of 25 for brunch perfectly!  Highly recommended - crunchy French Toast, cheesy grits, shrimp & grits, Southern eggs Benedict, and brunch mimosas.

Brunch here is amazing. From the light and perfect biscuits to the smoked brisket hash, from the perfectly prepared eggs to the spicy bloody marys, this is a place that serves its patrons well.  Service was amazing and seated a large party on hardly any notice, handled us with aplomb and made sure we were happy happy campers by the end.  Don't miss: shrimp and grits, corn muffins, spicy bloody Mary.

Went for a family dinner. We were seated quickly with a reservation even though the restaurant was not crowded.  The staff were friendly. Food was just ok. The crab cakes were not very good.  May have just ordered the wrong meal but wasn't impressed with the food.

My girlfriend likes this place a lot, but she finds it too expensive. Myself, I found my cornbread pancakes okay, but a little weird. Her omelet was good, but I didn't see anything that special. She continues to say that it was the best brunch she's ever had here in Chicago. The total bill was over $30, excluding tip, for two people to eat breakfast. Maybe I ordered something that I would hate or just caught them on an off day.

The first time I attempted to go to this place was several weeks back when they were closed for some construction. Yesterday, it was finally my chance to give this place a try. They had $5 hurricanes and $7 margaritas that were nice and strong. The food was alright--I had the pan-fried catfish which was nice and juicy. The cheese grits were alright, and the collard greens weren't all that special. Our server had a great attitude and we enjoyed his pleasant demeanor. However, it would've been nicer if he had been able to stop by our table more often without us trying to flag him down, particularly when it wasn't all that busy.

I just relocated to Chicago and being a native new Orleanian, I am always in search of flavorful food that takes me bake home and this place does just that.  The Bloody Marys are to die for and those biscuits are the devil.  i go to this place as often as I can. Even the etoufee is good and I NEVER find good etoufee outside of New Orleans.  It's not a setting for a romantic outing due to the noise level but hey, that reminds me of home too.

Today, I had the worst carry-out service ever.  It took 10 minutes on the phone to order 3 meals, because I was put on hold three times and the staff did not seem familiar with the specials.  When I picked up my order, it was missing one side.  I also received two sides that I did not order or want.  We also received 1 cornbread muffin for 3 people to share.  What an incredibly disappointing experience!  1 star for the service.  Another star because the food was okay.

Great moonshine cocktails. A lot of options for vegetarians. Big portions. Took a bit to get our food but they seemed understaffed. Overall everyones food and drinks were great, and you cant beat the prices.

Years ago (over one decade) I would have rated Wishbone with five stars. However, it has definitely changed over the years. My expectations were high for this place since I used to go here often when I lived in the River North area of Chicago. Don't get me wrong -- the food was flavorful but not unique. Quality food?  Some of it was quality. I give the cheesy grits five stars (if I could give it 10-stars I would) as well as the buttermilk biscuits (fluffy, light, buttery, flaky, and melt in your mouth delectable).  We ordered the Wishbone Omelette which was served with potatoes, onions, cheddar cheese & cilantro salsa. There was really nothing unique about this omelette. We also had the Jambalaya Omelette juxtaposed with spicy cajun stew with chicken, chicken andouille sausage, peppers, onion and tomato. This omelette is actually worth four stars, because it was definitely filled with an explosion of flavors. Service was attentive but not over-the-top attentive. Water glasses were filled without us having to ask for more water. Our Server stopped by a few times to make sure we didn't need anything else, which was a nice touch.  If you want to try something different, I highly recommend the Jambalaya omelette (it's big enough for two people to share). The Owner was walking around asking "how is everything" to some of the customers, which we appreciated. It illustrates how involved he is with his business and that he has a passion for his restaurant as well as customers. There are dishes on their menu that appeared to be Vegan friendly as well as a good place for Vegetarians. If I am visiting my friend again, who lives a few blocks from this restaurant, I would stop here again. I want to give them a second chance and, hopefully, bump it up to five stars the next time around.  This is the kind of food that one would eat during cold winter months. There's lots of comfort food.
Jaime was awesome. Bloodys were great. Shrimp and grits warm my soul. Blackened catfish hmmm

Showing up early, coming in with low expectations, and enjoying the great customer service is the best way to experience Wishbone.  I dropped by this morning at 8:30 AM with my wife, our one-month-old, and a family of four that included two kids under the age of three, and this time and our seating location were perfect in this massive eatery.  My smoked beef brisket hash was very ordinary; a bit too much meat (you won't hear me say that often) and it was kinda dry, with eggs that were also a little dry and a corn muffin that was so-so.  At this point, I was in the three-star category...but then I tried my wife's buttermilk biscuit (very tasty, moist enough, large) and ordered a great chocolate milkshake to wash it all down.  Add in our incredible server and this elevated it a bit in my mind, but again, I was here early and didn't have to fight any crowds. I might try a more traditional Southern dish next time, and my wife said the black bean cakes were pretty good.  Not even close to the top tier of brunch places in Chicago but a very solid performer if you've got kids and can sort through the large menu for a winner.  (With a menu this large and space this massive, it would be almost impossible to be great and cater to all of the brunch audiences Wishbone is trying to cover.) Prices are also a little better (stress on little) than most West Loop restaurants, so that's a plus if you live in the neighborhood and want to save a tiny bit over some of your other choices.

I've lived in the west loop for 8 years and just recently patronized Wishbone.  I know it's a neighborhood brunch staple but has unfortunately eluded me.   Not sure why because the food was so good!  We had the North Carolina style crab cakes,  shrimp and grits,  and a spicy chicken andouille hash. Everything was delicious and  tasted down home authentic.  The favors were bold and ingredients so fresh.  But what it more remarkable is how affordable the price point was considering how humongous the portions were. Not only did my friend and I eat until we were stuffed, but had plenty to take home as well. The only thing that was really a miss for us was the service.  It was really slow when we were there and still had to wait a long time to place our order.  Once we got our food, our waitress didn't check back with us to make sure everything was ok, when in fact it wasn't because we needed a couple of things missing from our table and a refill on our coffee.   So, I'm willing to go back for the food and willing to overlook the service because I did love my meal so much.  I'm hoping that the service was a fluke and that I can upgrade my review to four stars upon my next visit,  we shall see...
Another great lunch at wishbone, feta and spinach omelette for me and eggs over easy with bacon for my bro!

Don't understand why people rave about it so much. I had the biscuits and gravy with eggs scrambled soft on the side. I spent time in Ms and AL... No where near it. No flavor & not enough gravy by far. I stopped eating because it was nothing but crumbly biscuits because the gravy was no where to be found. The eggs were just that but they were cooked correctly. I had two mimosas and no buzz at all and I'm not a drinker by far. I was looking for a buzz and a good bite with a dear friend at least I enjoyed my conversation. Too bad Wishbone I wanted to love ya!

I tried to go here once before for lunch but was disappointed to see they are closed from 3 to 5. I persevered though and went for dinner a few days later. I love any place that allows me to eat breakfast for dinner. Their corn pancakes were amazing and my fried eggs were perfectly cooked. The service was fast too. My boyfriend's mom was visiting from out of town and I took a risk picking a new restaurant to take her to, but she loved it!

I came here for dinner and loved it! Great, casual atmosphere and really friendly and fast service. I ordered the chicken gumbo to start and then the crawfish etouffee, and they were both delicious. They tasted just as good as they did in New Orleans, very authentic Cajun/Creole food. I will definitely be back!
I had the salmon patty breakfast. It was interesting and different, but didn't blow me away. The place definitely fills up fast on the weekends so you can pretty much expect some type of wait.

Decent place for winter or if the restaurant of your choice is too packed!  Came here for brunch after trying to go to RM Champagne (which by the way does not do brunch anymore) and Little Goat (which is STILL hard to get into). Anyway, came here and didn't think I would find many veg. options and...I was right. There were only three modified items and some sides I could order: black bean cakes, chicken salad without chicken, and the veggie burger without the patty.  First f all, who eats a veggie burger without the patty?!  What the hell is the point then? So basically I got the black bean cakes after one of the servers raved about it and it surprisingly good. It came with sautéed spinach, fruit, and my choice of bread (toast or corn bread).  The black bean cakes were pretty tiny but they were filling (not overly filling to the point of wanting to vomit, but filling enough).  My two friends who ordered the pancakes and grits really liked what they ordered. The restaurant was nice and toasty and in this horribly-cold Chicago weather, it works.   I probably wouldn't come back, though, but it was nice that the only veg./vegan option was actually decent. If you're a meat-eater, you'll probably love Wishbone so give it a try!  However, while I think it is great the only veg./vegan option was pretty good, I probably wouldn't come back here, though.

I have never really tried southern food so I can't really compare. I ordered their Corn Cakes. It's been about 3 hours since I consumed those pancakes, and I still have the after taste in my mouth haha. They're different, but I like them - kinda taste like pepperjack/ queso dip with jalapeno peppers but in a more solid form. Service was alright, nothing too memorable. It's a Wednesday afternoon, not sure why two pancakes and one pulled pork sandwich took so long.

I've eaten at Wishbone numerous times, but this review is specifically for their catering.  They catered our wedding, and really did a fabulous job.  Linda was our contact, and she was really great.  Very friendly and responsive.  Leading up to the wedding, I emailed her (what felt like) every day, and she always responded within a few hours, or first thing the next morning.  Also, we had to rent a dance floor for our venue, and we were able to do that through her, for a very reasonable price.  One less vendor I had to deal with, so I jumped when she offered.  We also had a lot of "extras" at the reception (multiple favors, centerpieces, candles, signs for signature drinks, candy, card box, etc). A few days before, I sent her a list of everything and where it all went. My mom and my husband's mom were both nervous that everything would be put out correctly, so they went to the venue about an hour before cocktail hour started.  Imagine my surprise when we got back from taking pictures and they were both waiting in the lobby, chatting, and looking not the least bit stressed.  Apparently when they got there, Linda and her staff had everything set up perfectly and there wasn't a thing for them to do. Also, we really appreciated the way Linda worked with our budget.  They didn't charge a cake cutting fee, and Linda was great when it came to adding extras, like coffee, late night food, etc. As far as the food...it was great.  I've had multiple people tell me they loved the food and passed appetizers.  What I had was really good, and my husband liked it a lot too (he can be a picky eater, so that was a bonus).   There were a few hiccups, but nothing too bad.  They ran out of brisket on the buffett, which was one of the main dishes.  I think we had told them 115, but we only had 112 there, so I was surprised that they ran out (I think maybe only 3 or 4 people were left when they ran out).  It was just a little disappointing, since they had someone carving it, so they should have known a little better how much to give each person so that everyone was able to get some. Also, we ordered the alcohol through Binny's (who takes back everything unopened).  There were a few bottles that were opened, but still full, and some of the beer didn't get  into the "back to Binny's" pile at the end of the night.  Overall, less than $100 in alcohol, but still slightly annoying. I would definitely use them again to cater an event.  Linda was very knowledgeable, and definitely a great resource when I was wedding planning.

I had the pancakes, southern eggs Benedict and grits they were all very good. Wife got brisket hash and scrambled eggs with berry pancakes she said they were very good. Friend had shrimp and grits she loved it. All the meals look very good and service was fast and food was hot. Don't miss out on a good breakfast when visiting Chicago. 12 min by cab when staying at the Hilton on Michigan blvd.

So, my husband and I have been eating breakfast at Wishbone for years. The food is always good and the service is usually questionable......just keeping it real! It's nice to have an alternative to the traditional pancakes and bacon type breakfast restaurants. I always get the shrimp & grits or the chicken andouille hash. Both of these dishes are awesome! My husband ALWAYS gets the salmon cakes breakfast.....it's so good to him, he never gives himself a chance to try anything else. Next time we go I will definitely take some pics. As far as the service goes, there's a handful of waitresses that are always hard to find and just kind of slow with taking your order, getting drinks, and etc. One of them is so bad, whenever we're seated in her area, we just request to be moved. However, the food is so good, we'll keep returning.

This place has been around for a while, and is well established, BUT on a recent visit I have to say I was very disappointed. I was there in the evening, early, and the place was about one third full, but the service was extremely slow. Took forever to order; took forever to get the food (maybe 35 mins between sitting down and the food being in front of us!). The food is simple, and not particularly well done, so it's unacceptable for dinner for two people to take 35 mins to prepare! Wait staff had the real teflon reaction to my questions about the delay....hey don't look at me, not my fault, talk to the kitchen, type of attitude.... Despite this it still took about 10 mins between paying......and my server coming back with the change!! Too many other good places. Move on.

As a Bostonian, I used to date a Chicago girl who lived next door to Wishbone, so she introduced me to its breakfast when I first visited a couple years back. Now single and with her out of town I made a return that I have been dying to make. I ordered the Breakfast Burrito w/Cheese Grits and a Biscuit. Amazing. Presentation was good- not overly dramatic but enough to make you notice it, the flavors were very good and coupled with my coffee very well. This is no corner breakfast joint... this is much, much more. Seriously, this place is a must-do on my list any time I am in Chicago. Specifically the Cheese Grits. The server, despite a full restaurant, was attentive, helpful, timely, and knowledgeable. The table was clean, the restaurant was overall clean, and service was overall very good. The only hiccup occurred when I first arrive... I stood awkwardly at the door for 3 or 4 minutes waiting to be seated. But once I got seated it was smooth and swift service. If you havent been here, make your way over. And make sure you get the Cheese Grits

I was visiting a friend who used to live in the neighborhood, and she took me here for brunch.  She dined here at least once a week (when she lived in the area) and loved it every time.   I had the crunchy french toast, which was a breakfast carb-lover's dream.  To drink I had a bloody mary which had just the right amount of spice and pepper added to it.  My friend had the eggs benedict which was good too. The service was fast and friendly, and they had no problem splitting checks among our group.
Large portions of very good, hearty southern fare.  We always enjoy our trips to Wishbone.  The food is great, the service excellent, drinks are stiff, and the ambiance is interesting.

The food is excellent and the waiters are very nice but the hosts are incredibly rude. We went for a surprise birthday party and the hostess spoiled it after telling her to please not say anything when the birthday girl arrived. When we were seated, the hostess rolled her eyes at us and threw the menus at us. The food is very good, but they really need to learn how to be nicer to their guests.

Our waitress was awesome, hostess not so much.  I had the jambalaya omelet which was pretty decent.  A little on the bland side, but nothing a little hot sauce couldn't fix, same goes for the Bloody Mary.  I'd return for the potatoes.

Had the best breakfast ever.  I had the salmon patty breakfast.  The most flavorful salmon ever.   Also the service was excellent our waiter was attentive and funny.  I will definitely eat here every time I am in Chicago.

Came in again today for lunch with my partner. For some reason, I thought Brunch was Sunday and Monday because of the early closing. But still had a good time. My partner ordered the Etouffee, couldn't remember if it was Crawfish or Shrimp but was really good, bursting with flavor. I had the Carnival platter, which was one of earth seafood cake, also had the red beans/rice and green beans, as picked by our server. Made excellent choices as I left it up to him. The crawfish and crab cakes were delicious but the salmon had a different taste. I had their grilled salmon Friday and was excellent.  Our server, Jamie was also friendly, very hospitable, and was there before we needed to ask for anything. Both noticed his rainbow bracelet, and it's great that the establishment allows their employees to be themselves.  Only gave it a 4 star again because both times, corn muffins were dry. Plus decor could use a new look.
We frequently come here for breakfast on the weekends. Food is good. Service is a bit slow. Very comfortable environment. Nice staff. Love their home fries!!  Make sure to stop by Wishbone!

Everything was amazing! Service was attentive, we got our food right away, the grits were the best i have ever had, bacon was perfectly cooked and their corn muffin was delicious... I recommend anyone that wants a southern cooked breakfast to come here :)

The mimosas and bloody marys are really good. I ordered the Big Red which is their version of a chilaquile, not bad, the beans were especially good.   The service was generally good, couldn't really think of anything major that stood out.  The waitress was nice and the rest of the wait staff friendly.
Wishbone is basically the crack spot. So many gluten free options, such dank southern food, I go here for lunch every week.

First off, they don't have ranch. The drinks were so sweet- my margarita was horrible. I ordered a veggie burger on a brioche bun- it came on a hamburger bun. The Mac & Cheese was horrendous- how can you ruin such a staple? I would not go here again, it seems very 1998, needs a remodel and menu update.

Good food, friendly service & nice set-up. Got a brisket sandwich, slaw and a coke for under $10. Only reason I'm not going 5 stars is I didnt have a big enough meal to rate the more complex dishes. Will def be back.

Worked with Wishbone for our wedding catering - they were AMAZING. Linda, the caterer coordinator, was wonderful to work with. She was always available via phone or email and gave us plenty of good suggestions. Hands down the best food we've had at a wedding to date! And affordable, too! Would definitely recommend
Just finished an excellent lunch at wishbone. Comfort food, made from scratch...  Absolutely brilliant. Good wholesome food, good service, enough said...

I HHHHATE grits!  Hate them.  I was reluctant to even try it, as for the past 38 years, I couldn't STAND for a grit, oatmeal, farina, egg, or any other simarly textured item to be in my mouth.  THESE grits??? Shrimp and Grits -- FANTASTIC!!!! I am so excited to have found that I can enjoy a breakfast dish!  WISHBONE!!  I LOVE it and I -- the world's pickiest eater and breakfast-non-lover -- will be back, will bring friends, and WILL continue to RAVE about my Shrimp and Grits!

I woke up Saturday morning with a bout of Overserved Whiskeyitis and texted a friend about the cruel breakfast I was making myself: a green smoothie.  I told her I was going to pretend it was bacon.  From bacon, my mind wandered to shrimp and grits...shortly thereafter, I was washing off the mascara I "forgot" to remove the night before and grabbing my keys to head to Wishbone.  There was no wait - Sunday would have been a different story.  The waitstaff is always friendly, the food is delicious (although, lately, I only eat the shrimp and grits) and I don't feel as though I'm getting some froo froo fancy version of southern cooking.  The only downside to Wishbone is the lack of bottomless mimosas. I would never leave if I could drink mimosas bottomlessly...which is probably why they're expensive and you only get one.  Nonetheless, I always bring out of towners here for brunch and they love it as well.

Just my humble opinion, but this is the best breakfast restuarant in the city. Obviously there are others of different style that are right up there like TEMPO and sweet maple cafe and bongo room, but for Cajun style food this is the bomb!!! Try the red eggs and the fresh veggie juices.

Went there today and was very excited because I had heard all sorts of great thing. Got there around 10:15am no wait that was great!  I immediately ordered a pancake for my kid. I ordered a banana one. We got strawberry. I had the crab cakes Benedict. It was ok. There was egg shell in my food and the crab cakes were so small I could barely taste them. Honestly it was not very good. Hubby had the chicken hash. He was very happy. Unless he wants to go back. I am not going back. 2 hours later I have a pretty bad stomach ache. Ick.

Solid place, consistent food, Not terribly hard to get into during "hipster doofus stand outside and wait for an hour to be called brunch" peak times, probably due to size.  had the jambalaya omelette.  Good!  Nice folks working there and they do a good job.  Potatoes and grits both good, always a tough choice to accompany my omelette.

This was my first time at either Wishbone, and it's a pretty well-known place, so I was excited!  We found surprisingly easy parking on Saturday around 11:30 am, and also didn't have to wait for a table.  They had a nice covered patio, but there was a 25 minute wait for that.  Too bad as it might be one of the last few patio-friendly days! I started with a glass of fresh squeezed orange juice which was a little cheaper than what it usually costs at a brunch place.  It was so hard to decide what to have, but I finally went for the chicken andouille hash with sunny side up eggs and wheat toast.  I was starving, but my portion definitely seemed more manageable than most breakfast joints.  The hash was pretty good, sausage a little bit spicy and cut in small pieces.  Onions and potatoes all cooked to the right texture.  I had fun mixing my egg yolk around in there.  Eggs could've stood a little more cooking, they had a layer of that clear slippery stuff on the top that I pulled off with my fork and moved to the side.  Not very appealing.  Wheat toast was yer regular sandwich bread, butter came from little packets on the table. I didn't taste it, but my friend got the crunchy French toast, which appears to be deep fried.  She said it is her favorite thing, and it did look pretty delicious - her side of bacon was also beautifully crisp as she requested. All-in-all it was a really standard brunch.  The flavor of the sausage was the only above-average thing about it.  It was certainly satisfying but very similar to what you can get almost anywhere else.  I'd be happy to come back though, as the Southern menu looks so delicious and promising, I can't help but think some dishes may be good, but others are hopefully great!  Worth a try I'd say, and hopefully they'll exceed expectations!
Everything we ordered was excellent and the service was great; they were super accommodating, even for a party of twelve.

Group of us from the office reserved and went here.. mmm mm.. got the seafood gumbo.. crab cake, sweet mashed potato, biscuit.. pretty damn good. The biscuit was a tad drier than I like. Love the spicy ketchup. Friendly server, a bit slow on returning to grab the bill but the place was really busy.

Great brunch! I've been there twice, and found the entrees to be very reasonably priced (good food for the money), great service, and nice location. I wanted a mimosa the first time I went, but we were too early (no alcohol before 10 am), but when I came back, i finally did so -- wow! Moving into the West Loop, I see this place becoming a Sunday morning regular...

I just received a very appropriate and apologetic response to my review from the owner of Wishbone, Joel.  He emphasized that they will be using my review as an opportunity to learn and improve, which I very much appreciate. I will re-emphasize that we do love wishbone for brunch - so this review only refers to the catering bid process.

My husband and I were there on yesterday Aug31st.. I had my favvvvv SHRIMP N CHEESY GRITS! this is the absolute best dish EVER!!!  my husband enjoyed his fav the Blacken Catfish.. it is so fulfilling ... I enjoy going here occasionally you can not go wrong!
Great Southern cooking in a great Northern town.  The cheese grits are wonderful. Everything our party of four had was excellent. The service was a little slow, but the food was worth the wait.

Haven't been back since my post in 2011. Came for a lunch meeting. Im extremely boring food wise so I just had the waiter choose something for me :) He got me Chicken Gumbo and it was a great choice. Delicious. Also had some corn muffins. Everything was very good. I'll be back to try more items. Staff was so friendly.

I guess I'm not too much into Southern cooking. I came here with two friends for dinner on a weekday. We sat outside, which had a nice breeze in the West loop. Our waiter was nice. We started out with an appetizer that maybe it was called fried green tomatos? It's like a batter with tomatoes inside. I did not like it. It wasn't for me...I had one piece and couldn't finish it. As an entree I ordered the salmon cakes with mac and cheese and home fries (whole potatoes) as my sides. My salmon cakes were decent. The mac and cheese were meh, and the home fries were decent. One friend ordered the crab cakes - she liked it, she ate it very fast along wtih her side of green beans and sweet mashed potato. My other friend ordered their catfish with the same sides. I'm not sure how he felt about his catfish. There were no reviews. We ended the night with bread pudding. It was an actual slice of cake! I guess our impression of bread pudding is completely different. It was only my one friend who ate the whole big piece. He said it was good.  Overall decent food, but I'm not sure if I'll come back again. Like I said this kind of food is just not my type. What I did like about this place is that we were able to stay and chat for a long time. We finished eating and paid the bill, and we were still able to stick around. They close at 9pm on a weekday and we stayed close to 10pm without the staff kicking us out. I can tell they were closing up since they closed some of the lights, only one staff was around to clean up, and some of the tables and chairs were moved. But we still got to stay and chat to catch up with our friends. Thanks for not kicking us out even when you guys close!
I had the Hoppin Jack and added blackened chicken. Very good and filling. Very reasonable.
My family and I went to Wishbone for the first time and we all REALLY!!! enjoyed our food. #we'llbeback

This place sucks.  I'm actually very curious how it can have so many 4 and 5 star reviews.  Perhaps those folks aren't familiar with properly cooked BBQ. Last night I had the brisket plate.  They didn't put any effort into the mac and cheese side I got (and it showed) but I was able to eat it.  Anyone can cook just as good mac n cheese out of any box from the grocery.  The home fries were ok.  There was no way that brisket was cooked that same day.  If it was, they need to fire everyone who handles their meat.  It was pretty clearly reheated or just over cooked to death on the first go.  I'll give their meat guys the benefit of the doubt and assume that it was cooked mostly properly the first time and that they just reheated my plate. As a BBQ place you have to get your brisket right.  They didn't.  So I feel the most I can give them is 2 stars.  I grew up in Texas and have had far more than my fair share of BBQ.   Our waiter was bad/slow as well (I am not one to typically complain about service, but he was especially bad). As a point of comparison, Smoque over by the Irving park blue line stop is LIGHTYEARS ahead of this place.  Perhaps whoever cooks their meat should go by Smoque and get some tips.

Highly recommend this restaurant. My family and I are first-timers here and we each ordered various dishes to try. All were super delish especially the corn bread and coffee.  Servings were pretty generous.  Our server Annette was wonderful.

My son and I tucked in to our shrimp & grits with delight; however, a few bites later, things slowed down as we realized how salty our food was, and finally, we couldn't even eat it, it was so salty.  We left more than half of it on our plates.  The pecan pie, iced tea and coffee were all good, though.
Good solid service.  Great southern breakfast.  Love the crawfish cakes.  Can get really busy.

The servers were really friendly.  I had my son and everyone was super attentive. The Cajun Jambalaya Stew was good. It wasn't as spicy as I would have luked but good nonetheless.  If you drink I would stick to basic cocktails. My table ordered various mixed drinks from margaritas to hurricanes  they were lacking in flavor and heavily iced. The sweet tea was excellent though. All in all it was a good experience.

I once had a pretentious Southern Bell tell me she would never even try this place- because it was clearly a hack at Cajun cooking.  How narrow minded. Wishbone is awesome for these reasons.  Portion sizes are great (for the price)...their patio is dog friendly... their service is always great...and their cheese grits are literally delish.  The rest of their cuisine has a southern flair to tradition breakfast foods (I have only had breakfast and brunch, sorry) and the twang of taste is a great departure from the french toast or chocolate chippy pancakes at ______ (insert the name of any of the hip breakfast places here).  I don't go all the time, I go to other places more often than this.  But if I have friends visiting from out of town who want something that is not "some fancy fluffy omelette and over prices pancakes" that offers a little more of a big-city adventure we come here.

the shrimp and grits here are to die for! also the mississippi mud coffee is delish! service can be a little slow when they are busy, but it's worth the wait! love the outdoor patio in the summer, being able to sit outside with the pup while eating good food makes me happy :)
This place is the spot for true southern food. Every dish I've had has been great.. blackened catfish ,  gravy and biscuits, shrimp and grits! Comfort food at its best. Eat here...often
Love. Nice food selection. First time for this locale... good stuff though!

Man, what a gold mine!!  I've eaten here many times for lunch but my most recent visit was for breakfast.  The food is fantastic and even with such a crowded restaurant, the service was still fantastic.  I would highly recommend.
Awesome lunch spot right around the corner from work. Been here twice and ordered the jambalaya and the blackened salmon. Both tasty choices and the service is great !

I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!  This is a place I can come to whenever Im dieting or eating all the comfort food I want.I like coming in the summer especially and eat in their outdoor patio.Awesome Jambalaya!!!! Totally recommend.

I hadn't been here in a while and I was glad to be back! My go-tos here are the shrimp and grits and the blackened catfish. I should have known that those are the top 1 and 2 menu items for everybody! Well since it was my first time back in at least 6 months, I wanted to venture out and try something different. I went with the shrimp omelet and it did not disappoint! It was well prepared and heartily filled with shrimp. I had cheese grits and a biscuit on the side. Was there anything left on my plate, you ask? Ummmm, no ma'am. Everything was very tasty. Including the fresh strawberry lemonade. The couple to my right ordered it and it looked too good not to try. I surprised myself by not ordering a tasty brunch beverage but I will have you know that they do offer up a good selection of mimosas, bellinis, bloody marys, etc. So bottoms up and yay for brunch! Oh and let me add that for a gorgeous Sunday afternoon, the 25 minute wait wasn't so bad. The place was packed inside and out. Nevertheless, the waitress apologized for the wait because she had noticed me when I arrived and wondered why it took so long for me to be seated. I appreciated her thoughtfulness.

Mmm mmm..Wishbone has the best shrimp n grits in Chicago. If anyone disagrees tell me where and I will check it out. Let's see..we had 1) shrimp n cheese grits with bacon and mushrooms were so damn awesome! You know you should be ashamed if yourself when you're scraping the bowl for those last cheesy bits of grits? Well dammit I wasn't. Mind ur business! 2) French toast drenched in butter/maple syrup. How could that ever be wrong.  3) Brisket Hash was ok. Brisket could have been more tender.  4) N.C. crab cakes were great. My friend got them with biscuits(too thick for me), home fries and eggs. He.was.stuffed. Coffee, juice, completed our meal. Great experience as always. I've been coming to Wishbone for years and will continue to come as long as the food stays great.

Great place!  The food is great, the service is great!  The place is huge, including a large covered outdoor patio that is dog friendly!  The waiter was very sweet to my pup, saying hello and bringing her water.  Service was quick (really quick!) and the menu is quite large...including drinks and desserts!  Get the key lime pie and the yummy $5 special mango margarita.   +$8 valet parking +outdoor seating +dog friendly patio It gets busy at lunch and weekend brunch, but grabbing a table for 5:00 dinner of Saturday was no problem.  Definitely worth a visit!

Went there last weekend.  It was actually more like 3.5 stars but I rounded down because it didnt blow me away.  It was pretty crowded for brunch but we got seated very quickly.  The place is pretty big yet cozy inside as someone else mentioned.   I wish they had more outdoor seating, they only had a tiny section that i saw.  Interior is nice but not awesome.  Service was very nice and friendly and very quick.  Our waiter was helpful and came back to check on us often, even a waitress who wasnt at our table refilled my coffee when passing, that was pretty cool.  The food was good, above average but didn't excite the tastebuds a ton, portions were pretty big.  I gota denver omelete-pretty good,  but nothing spectacular. My gf got a jambalaya omelete, very interesting and different, i took a bite, it was pretty good.  The cheesy grits were new for me and we both really dug them.  Oh, and the price was very cheap, it was less than $25 for two, you can't beat that.  Overall a good experience. Oh, and I'm wondering about the poodle too, what's up with that?  I remember the TV show "Wishbone" from my youth, that dog looked different.

An overwhelming menu with most unusual concoctions! The bloody mary wasn't as great as you would expect for such a brunchy joint. The smoked brisket hash was AMAZING! Nice atmosphere and awesome cafeteria-style lunch spread! I will definitely come back to try the jambalaya omelet!

This is one of my go-to dinner places. The food is delicous, they have a juicer and can make fresh juice, and their pecan pie is fantastic. Week nights aren't too busy for dinner either, so there's not usually a wait. The ambience and decor are fun too--cozy, bright, and creative.

Went here yesterday. Use to come here a lot in the late 90s.  The food is still great. The service still sucks but with the food being so good I kind of overlook it. Still my favorite coffee in town. Get the corn cakes. Also, on the weekends it's best to get here before 10:am if you don't like waiting.
Cheesy grits with shrimp. Killer!  I had a small taste of their smoked brisket for review. Subtle and very tender.  I'll have to try it on my next train layover.

Wishbone is great if you want a quick hot lunch or even a nice sit down.  I've had quite a bit on the menu...One of my favorites is the Blackened Catfish Po' Boy.  Delish!  I also love their omelettes and homefries.  The homefries are sauteed with onions and peppers.  Another gem...the cornbread. It's really flawless and they need to create like a cornbread dressing with it.  Since I often do take out, I enjoy their hot line.  You just walk in pick items off the line and I've been lucky enough to eat off my selection for two days for just under $10.  Not wait, no fuss.   HERE IS THE BAD NEWS...their salads are not with a dime but they charge you $12 for them!  They basically lack any creativity or substance.  I had their Louisiana salad and it literally was a container of romaine lettuce with 3 slices of cucumber and 3 slices of tomato.  That's it.  Total disappointment.  In summary, the lunch line, take out and breakfasts are winners.  Salads a bust!
