I'd go back just to make some stiff vodka lemonade's with that tasty beverage for summer refreshments.
Located in the west loop near Harpo Studios.  One night a week they have a live Jazz band.  Food was good.  Dinners are moderately priced.  Corn bread muffins are the best I've ever had.

Great soul food.  I've been here a bunch of times getting more breakfast fare.  Good stuff.  However, I do avoid anything with rice and beans.  Hopping Jack or whatever it is called.  Rice by itself is perfect.  Beans by itself (especially refried) is tasty.  Together as a side, sorry.   I do like the art around the place and it's got a great community vibe. UPDATE:  The brunch dish that I'll be going back for is th crunchy french toast.  It's got some great coating (bran flakes?) with the right amount of crackle on the outside.  At most breakfast joints, I've rarely ordered french toast since there's always better breakfast fare (pancakes or omelettes), but wow.  This beats Bongo Room's french toast hands down.

I'm gonna go out on a limb here and say that I thought the food was pretty good. I mean, its not gourmet... its comfort food. Still, I think it was above average for breakfast / brunch.  After waiting about 10-15 minutes for a table, our orders were taken without requiring us to sit around for too long. The service was quick, and the food was very tastey. I had Red Eggs, which were similar to Huevos Rancheros, but without chorizo. I'd definitely order those again. My friends had Andouille Sausage Hash and Fried French Toast. Both of them thought their meals were great, too.

A bit on the trendy side and the food is mostly soul food cooking.  My friend got the shrimp and grits - which I stay away from shrimp since I'm allergic but he made me take a picture of it which is shrimp, mushrooms and bacon in a cream sauce on top of cheese grits.  I personally liked their corn muffins best plus those were free.

I want so much to like this place - it has such an inviting atmosphere. But, the truth is that the food is only so-so. I've tried 3 or 4 dishes here and everything tipped towards the bland side of the scale. Especially dissapointing were the red beans and rice. I made the lipton rice-in-a-bag version once and that had more flavor than Wishbone's.

It's good food - the catfish and beancakes are delicious.  The corn muffins are excellent (real whole corn inside - ahh), and the standard eggs and sausage are just fine.  It's like a lot of places with great breakfast - the lunch and dinner are just ok.  The service is brisk and friendly, and parking across the street is $5, I think.  I don't have trouble finding a meter though.

I miss the laidback charm of it's original tiny location on Grand, but nevertheless the food remains excellent, unless you have a problem with southern soul food. Brunch is by far my favorite time to eat here, with their crab cake benedict and corn muffins. Beware, both locations are hella busy and you may wait up to 2 hours depending on what time you go.

I love this place, it is excellent on a Sunday, they have an all you can drink bloody mary bar for dirt cheap, definetely good for the hangover.  The food has a southern down home touch to it.  You have got to try their cheese grits, even if you are not a big fan of grits, believe me when I tell you they are to die for.
Good place for Sunday brunch.Gets very packed so come early or expect to wait. Great comfort food. I love their corn muffins. Yummy..

Oh 'comon people! I've been coming here almost once a week for YEARS. Super-fast service and comfort food at a great price with a large outdoor dining area. Blackened catfish is a fave, and if you can deal with the crowds, brunch on the weekends is excellent.
Love the corn muffins.  This place is more of a trendy spot to say that you have been there than a joint for really excellent food.  The food is ok, not the worse but not the best you'll ever eat!

Located next to Harpo Studios, it has been said that guests of the Oprah Winfrey Show dine here for lunch.  I visited once for dinner and found the menu mostly soul food or southern influenced.  I am pretty straight-forward with my dining, so things like mango coleslaw aren't exactly up my alley.  However, their cornbread is to die for and the service is pretty darn good, too.
